00051 #define LFSCK_LAYOUT_MAGIC_V1           0xB173AE14
00052 #define LFSCK_LAYOUT_MAGIC_V2           0xB1734D76

00056 struct lfsck_layout_seq {
00057         struct list_head         lls_list;
00058         __u64                    lls_seq;
00059         __u64                    lls_lastid;
00060         __u64                    lls_lastid_known;
00061         struct dt_object        *lls_lastid_obj;
00062         unsigned int             lls_dirty:1;
00063 };

00065 struct lfsck_layout_slave_target {
00066         /* link into lfsck_layout_slave_data::llsd_master_list. */
00067         struct list_head        llst_list;
00068         /* The position for next record in the rbtree for iteration. */
00069         struct lu_fid           llst_fid;
00070         /* Dummy hash for iteration against the rbtree. */
00071         __u64                   llst_hash;
00072         __u64                   llst_gen;
00073         atomic_t                llst_ref;
00074         __u32                   llst_index;
00075         /* How many times we have failed to get the master status. */
00076         int                     llst_failures;
00077 };
00078 
00079 struct lfsck_layout_slave_data {
00080         /* list for lfsck_layout_seq */
00081         struct list_head         llsd_seq_list;
00082 
00083         /* list for the masters involve layout verification. */
00084         struct list_head         llsd_master_list;
00085         spinlock_t               llsd_lock;
00086         __u64                    llsd_touch_gen;
00087         struct dt_object        *llsd_rb_obj;
00088         struct rb_root           llsd_rb_root;
00089         rwlock_t                 llsd_rb_lock;
00090         unsigned int             llsd_rbtree_valid:1;
00091 };

00093 struct lfsck_layout_slave_async_args {

00095         struct lfsck_component           *llsaa_com;
00096         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llsaa_llst;

00099 static inline void
00100 lfsck_layout_llst_put(struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst)
00101 {
00102         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&llst->llst_ref)) {
00103                 LASSERT(list_empty(&llst->llst_list));
00104 
00105                 OBD_FREE_PTR(llst);
00106         }
00107 }
00108 
00109 static inline int
00110 lfsck_layout_llst_add(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd, __u32 index)
00111 {
00112         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst;
00113         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *tmp;
00114         int                               rc   = 0;
00115 
00116         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(llst);
00117         if (llst == NULL)
00118                 return -ENOMEM;
00119 
00120         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&llst->llst_list);
00121         llst->llst_gen = 0;
00122         llst->llst_index = index;
00123         atomic_set(&llst->llst_ref, 1);
00124 
00125         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00126         list_for_each_entry(tmp, &llsd->llsd_master_list, llst_list) {
00127                 if (tmp->llst_index == index) {
00128                         rc = -EALREADY;
00129                         break;
00130                 }
00131         }
00132         if (rc == 0)
00133                 list_add_tail(&llst->llst_list, &llsd->llsd_master_list);
00134         spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00135 
00136         if (rc != 0)
00137                 OBD_FREE_PTR(llst);
00138 
00139         return rc;
00140 }
00141 
00142 static inline void
00143 lfsck_layout_llst_del(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd,
00144                       struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst)
00145 {
00146         bool del = false;
00147 
00148         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00149         if (!list_empty(&llst->llst_list)) {
00150                 list_del_init(&llst->llst_list);
00151                 del = true;
00152         }
00153         spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00154 
00155         if (del)
00156                 lfsck_layout_llst_put(llst);
00157 }
00158 
00159 static inline struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *
00160 lfsck_layout_llst_find_and_del(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd,
00161                                __u32 index, bool unlink)
00162 {
00163         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst;
00164 
00165         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00166         list_for_each_entry(llst, &llsd->llsd_master_list, llst_list) {
00167                 if (llst->llst_index == index) {
00168                         if (unlink)
00169                                 list_del_init(&llst->llst_list);
00170                         else
00171                                 atomic_inc(&llst->llst_ref);
00172                         spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00173 
00174                         return llst;
00175                 }
00176         }
00177         spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
00178 
00179         return NULL;
00180 }

00182 static struct lfsck_layout_req *
00183 lfsck_layout_assistant_req_init(struct lfsck_assistant_object *lso,
00184                                 struct dt_object *child, __u32 ost_idx,
00185                                 __u32 lov_idx)
00186 {
00187         struct lfsck_layout_req *llr;
00188 
00189         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(llr);
00190         if (llr == NULL)
00191                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00192 
00193         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&llr->llr_lar.lar_list);
00194         llr->llr_lar.lar_parent = lfsck_assistant_object_get(lso);
00195         llr->llr_child = child;
00196         llr->llr_ost_idx = ost_idx;
00197         llr->llr_lov_idx = lov_idx;
00198 
00199         return llr;
00200 }

00202 static void lfsck_layout_assistant_req_fini(const struct lu_env *env,
00203                                             struct lfsck_assistant_req *lar)
00204 {
00205         struct lfsck_layout_req *llr =
00206                         container_of0(lar, struct lfsck_layout_req, llr_lar);
00207 
00208         lfsck_object_put(env, llr->llr_child);
00209         lfsck_assistant_object_put(env, lar->lar_parent);
00210         OBD_FREE_PTR(llr);
00211 }

00213 static int
00214 lfsck_layout_assistant_sync_failures_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
00215                                                struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00216                                                void *args, int rc)
00217 {
00218         if (rc == 0) {
00219                 struct lfsck_async_interpret_args *laia = args;
00220                 struct lfsck_tgt_desc             *ltd  = laia->laia_ltd;
00221 
00222                 ltd->ltd_synced_failures = 1;
00223                 atomic_dec(laia->laia_count);
00224         }
00225 
00226         return 0;
00227 }
00228 
00250 static void lfsck_layout_assistant_sync_failures(const struct lu_env *env,
00251                                                  struct lfsck_component *com,
00252                                                  struct lfsck_request *lr)
00253 {
00254         struct lfsck_async_interpret_args *laia  =
00255                                 &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_laia2;
00256         struct lfsck_assistant_data       *lad   = com->lc_data;
00257         struct lfsck_layout               *lo    = com->lc_file_ram;
00258         struct lfsck_instance             *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
00259         struct lfsck_tgt_descs            *ltds  = &lfsck->li_ost_descs;
00260         struct lfsck_tgt_desc             *ltd;
00261         struct ptlrpc_request_set         *set;
00262         atomic_t                           count;
00263         __u32                              idx;
00264         int                                rc    = 0;
00265         ENTRY;
00266 
00267         if (!lad->lad_incomplete || lo->ll_flags & LF_INCOMPLETE)
00268                 RETURN_EXIT;
00269 
00270         /* If the MDT has ever failed to verfiy some OST-objects,
00271          * then sync failures with them firstly. */
00272         lr->lr_flags2 = lo->ll_flags | LF_INCOMPLETE;
00273 
00274         atomic_set(&count, 0);
00275         memset(laia, 0, sizeof(*laia));
00276         laia->laia_count = &count;
00277         set = ptlrpc_prep_set();
00278         if (set == NULL)
00279                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00280 
00281         down_read(&ltds->ltd_rw_sem);
00282         cfs_foreach_bit(lad->lad_bitmap, idx) {
00283                 ltd = lfsck_ltd2tgt(ltds, idx);
00284                 LASSERT(ltd != NULL);
00285 
00286                 laia->laia_ltd = ltd;
00287                 rc = lfsck_async_request(env, ltd->ltd_exp, lr, set,
00288                                 lfsck_layout_assistant_sync_failures_interpret,
00289                                 laia, LFSCK_NOTIFY);
00290                 if (rc != 0) {
00291                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: LFSCK assistant fail to "
00292                                "notify target %x for %s phase1 done: "
00293                                "rc = %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
00294                                ltd->ltd_index, lad->lad_name, rc);
00295 
00296                         break;
00297                 }
00298 
00299                 atomic_inc(&count);
00300         }
00301         up_read(&ltds->ltd_rw_sem);
00302 
00303         if (rc == 0 && atomic_read(&count) > 0)
00304                 rc = ptlrpc_set_wait(set);
00305 
00306         ptlrpc_set_destroy(set);
00307 
00308         if (rc == 0 && atomic_read(&count) > 0)
00309                 rc = -EINVAL;
00310 
00311         GOTO(out, rc);
00312 
00313 out:
00314         if (rc != 0)
00315                 /* If failed to sync failures with the OSTs, then have to
00316                  * mark the whole LFSCK as LF_INCOMPLETE to skip the whole
00317                  * subsequent orphan OST-object handling. */
00318                 lo->ll_flags |= LF_INCOMPLETE;
00319 
00320         lr->lr_flags2 = lo->ll_flags;
00321 }
00322 
00323 static int lfsck_layout_get_lovea(const struct lu_env *env,
00324                                   struct dt_object *obj, struct lu_buf *buf)
00325 {
00326         int rc;
00327 
00328 again:
00329         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, obj, buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV);
00330         if (rc == -ERANGE) {
00331                 rc = dt_xattr_get(env, obj, &LU_BUF_NULL, XATTR_NAME_LOV);
00332                 if (rc <= 0)
00333                         return rc;
00334 
00335                 lu_buf_realloc(buf, rc);
00336                 if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
00337                         return -ENOMEM;
00338 
00339                 goto again;
00340         }
00341 
00342         if (rc == -ENODATA)
00343                 rc = 0;
00344 
00345         if (rc <= 0)
00346                 return rc;
00347 
00348         if (unlikely(buf->lb_buf == NULL)) {
00349                 lu_buf_alloc(buf, rc);
00350                 if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
00351                         return -ENOMEM;
00352 
00353                 goto again;
00354         }
00355 
00356         return rc;
00357 }
00358 
00359 static int lfsck_layout_verify_header(struct lov_mds_md_v1 *lmm)
00360 {
00361         __u32 magic;
00362         __u32 pattern;
00363 
00364         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
00365         /* If magic crashed, keep it there. Sometime later, during OST-object
00366          * orphan handling, if some OST-object(s) back-point to it, it can be
00367          * verified and repaired. */
00368         if (magic != LOV_MAGIC_V1 && magic != LOV_MAGIC_V3) {
00369                 struct ost_id   oi;
00370                 int             rc;
00371 
00372                 lmm_oi_le_to_cpu(&oi, &lmm->lmm_oi);
00373                 if ((magic & LOV_MAGIC_MASK) == LOV_MAGIC_MAGIC)
00374                         rc = -EOPNOTSUPP;
00375                 else
00376                         rc = -EINVAL;
00377 
00378                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s LOV EA magic %u on "DOSTID"\n",
00379                        rc == -EINVAL ? "Unknown" : "Unsupported",
00380                        magic, POSTID(&oi));
00381 
00382                 return rc;
00383         }
00384 
00385         pattern = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_pattern);
00386         /* XXX: currently, we only support LOV_PATTERN_RAID0. */
00387         if (lov_pattern(pattern) != LOV_PATTERN_RAID0) {
00388                 struct ost_id oi;
00389 
00390                 lmm_oi_le_to_cpu(&oi, &lmm->lmm_oi);
00391                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "Unsupported LOV EA pattern %u on "DOSTID"\n",
00392                        pattern, POSTID(&oi));
00393 
00394                 return -EOPNOTSUPP;
00395         }
00396 
00397         return 0;
00398 }
00399 
00400 #define LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE        PAGE_CACHE_SIZE
00401 #define LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_WIDTH       (LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE << 3)
00402 #define LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_MASK        (LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_WIDTH - 1)
00403 
00404 struct lfsck_rbtree_node {
00405         struct rb_node   lrn_node;
00406         __u64            lrn_seq;
00407         __u32            lrn_first_oid;
00408         atomic_t         lrn_known_count;
00409         atomic_t         lrn_accessed_count;
00410         void            *lrn_known_bitmap;
00411         void            *lrn_accessed_bitmap;
00412 };
00413 
00414 static inline int lfsck_rbtree_cmp(struct lfsck_rbtree_node *lrn,
00415                                    __u64 seq, __u32 oid)
00416 {
00417         if (seq < lrn->lrn_seq)
00418                 return -1;
00419 
00420         if (seq > lrn->lrn_seq)
00421                 return 1;
00422 
00423         if (oid < lrn->lrn_first_oid)
00424                 return -1;
00425 
00426         if (oid - lrn->lrn_first_oid >= LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_WIDTH)
00427                 return 1;
00428 
00429         return 0;
00430 }
00431 
00432 /* The caller should hold llsd->llsd_rb_lock. */
00433 static struct lfsck_rbtree_node *
00434 lfsck_rbtree_search(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd,
00435                     const struct lu_fid *fid, bool *exact)
00436 {
00437         struct rb_node           *node  = llsd->llsd_rb_root.rb_node;
00438         struct rb_node           *prev  = NULL;
00439         struct lfsck_rbtree_node *lrn   = NULL;
00440         int                       rc    = 0;
00441 
00442         if (exact != NULL)
00443                 *exact = true;
00444 
00445         while (node != NULL) {
00446                 prev = node;
00447                 lrn = rb_entry(node, struct lfsck_rbtree_node, lrn_node);
00448                 rc = lfsck_rbtree_cmp(lrn, fid_seq(fid), fid_oid(fid));
00449                 if (rc < 0)
00450                         node = node->rb_left;
00451                 else if (rc > 0)
00452                         node = node->rb_right;
00453                 else
00454                         return lrn;
00455         }
00456 
00457         if (exact == NULL)
00458                 return NULL;
00459 
00460         /* If there is no exactly matched one, then to the next valid one. */
00461         *exact = false;
00462 
00463         /* The rbtree is empty. */
00464         if (rc == 0)
00465                 return NULL;
00466 
00467         if (rc < 0)
00468                 return lrn;
00469 
00470         node = rb_next(prev);
00471 
00472         /* The end of the rbtree. */
00473         if (node == NULL)
00474                 return NULL;
00475 
00476         lrn = rb_entry(node, struct lfsck_rbtree_node, lrn_node);
00477 
00478         return lrn;
00479 }
00480 
00481 static struct lfsck_rbtree_node *lfsck_rbtree_new(const struct lu_env *env,
00482                                                   const struct lu_fid *fid)
00483 {
00484         struct lfsck_rbtree_node *lrn;
00485 
00486         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(lrn);
00487         if (lrn == NULL)
00488                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00489 
00490         OBD_ALLOC(lrn->lrn_known_bitmap, LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE);
00491         if (lrn->lrn_known_bitmap == NULL) {
00492                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lrn);
00493 
00494                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00495         }
00496 
00497         OBD_ALLOC(lrn->lrn_accessed_bitmap, LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE);
00498         if (lrn->lrn_accessed_bitmap == NULL) {
00499                 OBD_FREE(lrn->lrn_known_bitmap, LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE);
00500                 OBD_FREE_PTR(lrn);
00501 
00502                 return ERR_PTR(-ENOMEM);
00503         }
00504 
00505         RB_CLEAR_NODE(&lrn->lrn_node);
00506         lrn->lrn_seq = fid_seq(fid);
00507         lrn->lrn_first_oid = fid_oid(fid) & ~LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_MASK;
00508         atomic_set(&lrn->lrn_known_count, 0);
00509         atomic_set(&lrn->lrn_accessed_count, 0);
00510 
00511         return lrn;
00512 }
00513 
00514 static void lfsck_rbtree_free(struct lfsck_rbtree_node *lrn)
00515 {
00516         OBD_FREE(lrn->lrn_accessed_bitmap, LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE);
00517         OBD_FREE(lrn->lrn_known_bitmap, LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_SIZE);
00518         OBD_FREE_PTR(lrn);
00519 }
00520 
00521 /* The caller should hold lock. */
00522 static struct lfsck_rbtree_node *
00523 lfsck_rbtree_insert(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd,
00524                     struct lfsck_rbtree_node *lrn)
00525 {
00526         struct rb_node           **pos    = &llsd->llsd_rb_root.rb_node;
00527         struct rb_node            *parent = NULL;
00528         struct lfsck_rbtree_node  *tmp;
00529         int                        rc;
00530 
00531         while (*pos != NULL) {
00532                 parent = *pos;
00533                 tmp = rb_entry(parent, struct lfsck_rbtree_node, lrn_node);
00534                 rc = lfsck_rbtree_cmp(tmp, lrn->lrn_seq, lrn->lrn_first_oid);
00535                 if (rc < 0)
00536                         pos = &(*pos)->rb_left;
00537                 else if (rc > 0)
00538                         pos = &(*pos)->rb_right;
00539                 else
00540                         return tmp;
00541         }
00542 
00543         rb_link_node(&lrn->lrn_node, parent, pos);
00544         rb_insert_color(&lrn->lrn_node, &llsd->llsd_rb_root);
00545 
00546         return lrn;
00547 }
00548 
00549 extern const struct dt_index_operations lfsck_orphan_index_ops;
00550 
00551 static int lfsck_rbtree_setup(const struct lu_env *env,
00552                               struct lfsck_component *com)
00553 {
00554         struct lu_fid                   *fid    = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_fid;
00555         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
00556         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck->li_bottom;
00557         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data  *llsd   = com->lc_data;
00558         struct dt_object                *obj;
00559 
00560         fid->f_seq = FID_SEQ_LAYOUT_RBTREE;
00561         fid->f_oid = lfsck_dev_idx(lfsck);
00562         fid->f_ver = 0;
00563         obj = dt_locate(env, dev, fid);
00564         if (IS_ERR(obj))
00565                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obj));
00566 
00567         /* Generate an in-RAM object to stand for the layout rbtree.
00568          * Scanning the layout rbtree will be via the iteration over
00569          * the object. In the future, the rbtree may be written onto
00570          * disk with the object.
00571          *
00572          * Mark the object to be as exist. */
00573         obj->do_lu.lo_header->loh_attr |= LOHA_EXISTS;
00574         obj->do_index_ops = &lfsck_orphan_index_ops;
00575         llsd->llsd_rb_obj = obj;
00576         llsd->llsd_rbtree_valid = 1;
00577         dev->dd_record_fid_accessed = 1;
00578 
00579         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK init OST-objects accessing bitmap\n",
00580                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck));
00581 
00582         return 0;
00583 }
00584 
00585 static void lfsck_rbtree_cleanup(const struct lu_env *env,
00586                                  struct lfsck_component *com)
00587 {
00588         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
00589         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data  *llsd  = com->lc_data;
00590         struct rb_node                  *node  = rb_first(&llsd->llsd_rb_root);
00591         struct rb_node                  *next;
00592         struct lfsck_rbtree_node        *lrn;
00593 
00594         lfsck->li_bottom->dd_record_fid_accessed = 0;
00595         /* Invalid the rbtree, then no others will use it. */
00596         write_lock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00597         llsd->llsd_rbtree_valid = 0;
00598         write_unlock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00599 
00600         while (node != NULL) {
00601                 next = rb_next(node);
00602                 lrn = rb_entry(node, struct lfsck_rbtree_node, lrn_node);
00603                 rb_erase(node, &llsd->llsd_rb_root);
00604                 lfsck_rbtree_free(lrn);
00605                 node = next;
00606         }
00607 
00608         if (llsd->llsd_rb_obj != NULL) {
00609                 lfsck_object_put(env, llsd->llsd_rb_obj);
00610                 llsd->llsd_rb_obj = NULL;
00611         }
00612 
00613         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK fini OST-objects accessing bitmap\n",
00614                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck));
00615 }
00616 
00617 static void lfsck_rbtree_update_bitmap(const struct lu_env *env,
00618                                        struct lfsck_component *com,
00619                                        const struct lu_fid *fid,
00620                                        bool accessed)
00621 {
00622         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data  *llsd   = com->lc_data;
00623         struct lfsck_rbtree_node        *lrn;
00624         bool                             insert = false;
00625         int                              idx;
00626         int                              rc     = 0;
00627         ENTRY;
00628 
00629         if (unlikely(!fid_is_sane(fid) || fid_is_last_id(fid)))
00630                 RETURN_EXIT;
00631 
00632         if (!fid_is_idif(fid) && !fid_is_norm(fid))
00633                 RETURN_EXIT;
00634 
00635         read_lock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00636         if (!llsd->llsd_rbtree_valid)
00637                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
00638 
00639         lrn = lfsck_rbtree_search(llsd, fid, NULL);
00640         if (lrn == NULL) {
00641                 struct lfsck_rbtree_node *tmp;
00642 
00643                 LASSERT(!insert);
00644 
00645                 read_unlock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00646                 tmp = lfsck_rbtree_new(env, fid);
00647                 if (IS_ERR(tmp))
00648                         GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(tmp));
00649 
00650                 insert = true;
00651                 write_lock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00652                 if (!llsd->llsd_rbtree_valid) {
00653                         lfsck_rbtree_free(tmp);
00654                         GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
00655                 }
00656 
00657                 lrn = lfsck_rbtree_insert(llsd, tmp);
00658                 if (lrn != tmp)
00659                         lfsck_rbtree_free(tmp);
00660         }
00661 
00662         idx = fid_oid(fid) & LFSCK_RBTREE_BITMAP_MASK;
00663         /* Any accessed object must be a known object. */
00664         if (!test_and_set_bit(idx, lrn->lrn_known_bitmap))
00665                 atomic_inc(&lrn->lrn_known_count);
00666         if (accessed && !test_and_set_bit(idx, lrn->lrn_accessed_bitmap))
00667                 atomic_inc(&lrn->lrn_accessed_count);
00668 
00669         GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
00670 
00671 unlock:
00672         if (insert)
00673                 write_unlock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00674         else
00675                 read_unlock(&llsd->llsd_rb_lock);
00676 out:
00677         if (rc != 0 && accessed) {
00678                 struct lfsck_layout *lo = com->lc_file_ram;
00679 
00680                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to update OST-objects accessing "
00681                        "bitmap, and will cause incorrect LFSCK OST-object "
00682                        "handling, so disable it to cancel orphan handling "
00683                        "for related device. rc = %d\n",
00684                        lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck), rc);
00685 
00686                 lo->ll_flags |= LF_INCOMPLETE;
00687                 lfsck_rbtree_cleanup(env, com);
00688         }
00689 }
00690 
00691 static void lfsck_layout_le_to_cpu(struct lfsck_layout *des,
00692                                    const struct lfsck_layout *src)
00693 {
00694         int i;
00695 
00696         des->ll_magic = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_magic);
00697         des->ll_status = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_status);
00698         des->ll_flags = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_flags);
00699         des->ll_success_count = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_success_count);
00700         des->ll_run_time_phase1 = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_run_time_phase1);
00701         des->ll_run_time_phase2 = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_run_time_phase2);
00702         des->ll_time_last_complete = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_time_last_complete);
00703         des->ll_time_latest_start = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_time_latest_start);
00704         des->ll_time_last_checkpoint =
00705                                 le64_to_cpu(src->ll_time_last_checkpoint);
00706         des->ll_pos_latest_start = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_pos_latest_start);
00707         des->ll_pos_last_checkpoint = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_pos_last_checkpoint);
00708         des->ll_pos_first_inconsistent =
00709                         le64_to_cpu(src->ll_pos_first_inconsistent);
00710         des->ll_objs_checked_phase1 = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_objs_checked_phase1);
00711         des->ll_objs_failed_phase1 = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_objs_failed_phase1);
00712         des->ll_objs_checked_phase2 = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_objs_checked_phase2);
00713         des->ll_objs_failed_phase2 = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_objs_failed_phase2);
00714         for (i = 0; i < LLIT_MAX; i++)
00715                 des->ll_objs_repaired[i] =
00716                                 le64_to_cpu(src->ll_objs_repaired[i]);
00717         des->ll_objs_skipped = le64_to_cpu(src->ll_objs_skipped);
00718         des->ll_bitmap_size = le32_to_cpu(src->ll_bitmap_size);
00719 }
00720 
00721 static void lfsck_layout_cpu_to_le(struct lfsck_layout *des,
00722                                    const struct lfsck_layout *src)
00723 {
00724         int i;
00725 
00726         des->ll_magic = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_magic);
00727         des->ll_status = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_status);
00728         des->ll_flags = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_flags);
00729         des->ll_success_count = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_success_count);
00730         des->ll_run_time_phase1 = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_run_time_phase1);
00731         des->ll_run_time_phase2 = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_run_time_phase2);
00732         des->ll_time_last_complete = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_time_last_complete);
00733         des->ll_time_latest_start = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_time_latest_start);
00734         des->ll_time_last_checkpoint =
00735                                 cpu_to_le64(src->ll_time_last_checkpoint);
00736         des->ll_pos_latest_start = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_pos_latest_start);
00737         des->ll_pos_last_checkpoint = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_pos_last_checkpoint);
00738         des->ll_pos_first_inconsistent =
00739                         cpu_to_le64(src->ll_pos_first_inconsistent);
00740         des->ll_objs_checked_phase1 = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_objs_checked_phase1);
00741         des->ll_objs_failed_phase1 = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_objs_failed_phase1);
00742         des->ll_objs_checked_phase2 = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_objs_checked_phase2);
00743         des->ll_objs_failed_phase2 = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_objs_failed_phase2);
00744         for (i = 0; i < LLIT_MAX; i++)
00745                 des->ll_objs_repaired[i] =
00746                                 cpu_to_le64(src->ll_objs_repaired[i]);
00747         des->ll_objs_skipped = cpu_to_le64(src->ll_objs_skipped);
00748         des->ll_bitmap_size = cpu_to_le32(src->ll_bitmap_size);
00749 }
00750 
00760 static int lfsck_layout_load_bitmap(const struct lu_env *env,
00761                                     struct lfsck_component *com)
00762 {
00763         struct dt_object                *obj    = com->lc_obj;
00764         struct lfsck_assistant_data     *lad    = com->lc_data;
00765         struct lfsck_layout             *lo     = com->lc_file_ram;
00766         struct cfs_bitmap                       *bitmap = lad->lad_bitmap;
00767         loff_t                           pos    = com->lc_file_size;
00768         ssize_t                          size;
00769         __u32                            nbits;
00770         int                              rc;
00771         ENTRY;
00772 
00773         if (com->lc_lfsck->li_ost_descs.ltd_tgts_bitmap->size >
00774             lo->ll_bitmap_size)
00775                 nbits = com->lc_lfsck->li_ost_descs.ltd_tgts_bitmap->size;
00776         else
00777                 nbits = lo->ll_bitmap_size;
00778 
00779         if (unlikely(nbits < BITS_PER_LONG))
00780                 nbits = BITS_PER_LONG;
00781 
00782         if (nbits > bitmap->size) {
00783                 __u32 new_bits = bitmap->size;
00784                 struct cfs_bitmap *new_bitmap;
00785 
00786                 while (new_bits < nbits)
00787                         new_bits <<= 1;
00788 
00789                 new_bitmap = CFS_ALLOCATE_BITMAP(new_bits);
00790                 if (new_bitmap == NULL)
00791                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00792 
00793                 lad->lad_bitmap = new_bitmap;
00794                 CFS_FREE_BITMAP(bitmap);
00795                 bitmap = new_bitmap;
00796         }
00797 
00798         if (lo->ll_bitmap_size == 0) {
00799                 lad->lad_incomplete = 0;
00800                 CFS_RESET_BITMAP(bitmap);
00801 
00802                 RETURN(0);
00803         }
00804 
00805         size = (lo->ll_bitmap_size + 7) >> 3;
00806         rc = dt_read(env, obj, lfsck_buf_get(env, bitmap->data, size), &pos);
00807         if (rc != size)
00808                 RETURN(rc >= 0 ? -EINVAL : rc);
00809 
00810         if (cfs_bitmap_check_empty(bitmap))
00811                 lad->lad_incomplete = 0;
00812         else
00813                 lad->lad_incomplete = 1;
00814 
00815         RETURN(0);
00816 }
00817 
00835 static int lfsck_layout_load(const struct lu_env *env,
00836                              struct lfsck_component *com)
00837 {
00838         struct lfsck_layout             *lo     = com->lc_file_ram;
00839         ssize_t                          size   = com->lc_file_size;
00840         loff_t                           pos    = 0;
00841         int                              rc;
00842 
00843         rc = dt_read(env, com->lc_obj,
00844                      lfsck_buf_get(env, com->lc_file_disk, size), &pos);
00845         if (rc == 0) {
00846                 return -ENOENT;
00847         } else if (rc < 0) {
00848                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: failed to load lfsck_layout: rc = %d\n",
00849                        lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck), rc);
00850                 return rc;
00851         } else if (rc != size) {
00852                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: lfsck_layout size %u != %u; reset it\n",
00853                        lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck), rc, (unsigned int)size);
00854                 return 1;
00855         }
00856 
00857         lfsck_layout_le_to_cpu(lo, com->lc_file_disk);
00858         if (lo->ll_magic != LFSCK_LAYOUT_MAGIC) {
00859                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: invalid lfsck_layout magic %#x != %#x, "
00860                        "to be reset\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
00861                        lo->ll_magic, LFSCK_LAYOUT_MAGIC);
00862                 return 1;
00863         }
00864 
00865         return 0;
00866 }
00867 
00883 static int lfsck_layout_store(const struct lu_env *env,
00884                               struct lfsck_component *com)
00885 {
00886         struct dt_object        *obj    = com->lc_obj;
00887         struct lfsck_instance   *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
00888         struct lfsck_layout     *lo_ram = com->lc_file_ram;
00889         struct lfsck_layout     *lo     = com->lc_file_disk;
00890         struct thandle          *th;
00891         struct dt_device        *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(obj);
00892         struct cfs_bitmap       *bitmap = NULL;
00893         loff_t                   pos;
00894         ssize_t                  size   = com->lc_file_size;
00895         __u32                    nbits  = 0;
00896         int                      rc;
00897         ENTRY;
00898 
00899         if (lfsck->li_master) {
00900                 struct lfsck_assistant_data *lad = com->lc_data;
00901 
00902                 bitmap = lad->lad_bitmap;
00903                 nbits = bitmap->size;
00904 
00905                 LASSERT(nbits > 0);
00906                 LASSERTF((nbits & 7) == 0, "Invalid nbits %u\n", nbits);
00907         }
00908 
00909         lo_ram->ll_bitmap_size = nbits;
00910         lfsck_layout_cpu_to_le(lo, lo_ram);
00911         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
00912         if (IS_ERR(th))
00913                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
00914 
00915         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, obj, lfsck_buf_get(env, lo, size),
00916                                      (loff_t)0, th);
00917         if (rc != 0)
00918                 GOTO(out, rc);
00919 
00920         if (bitmap != NULL) {
00921                 rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, obj,
00922                                 lfsck_buf_get(env, bitmap->data, nbits >> 3),
00923                                 (loff_t)size, th);
00924                 if (rc != 0)
00925                         GOTO(out, rc);
00926         }
00927 
00928         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
00929         if (rc != 0)
00930                 GOTO(out, rc);
00931 
00932         pos = 0;
00933         rc = dt_record_write(env, obj, lfsck_buf_get(env, lo, size), &pos, th);
00934         if (rc != 0)
00935                 GOTO(out, rc);
00936 
00937         if (bitmap != NULL) {
00938                 pos = size;
00939                 rc = dt_record_write(env, obj,
00940                                 lfsck_buf_get(env, bitmap->data, nbits >> 3),
00941                                 &pos, th);
00942         }
00943 
00944         GOTO(out, rc);
00945 
00946 out:
00947         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
00948 
00949 log:
00950         if (rc != 0)
00951                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: fail to store lfsck_layout: rc = %d\n",
00952                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), rc);
00953 
00954         return rc;
00955 }
00956 
00957 static int lfsck_layout_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00958                              struct lfsck_component *com)
00959 {
00960         struct lfsck_layout *lo = com->lc_file_ram;
00961         int rc;
00962 
00963         memset(lo, 0, com->lc_file_size);
00964         lo->ll_magic = LFSCK_LAYOUT_MAGIC;
00965         lo->ll_status = LS_INIT;
00966         down_write(&com->lc_sem);
00967         rc = lfsck_layout_store(env, com);
00968         up_write(&com->lc_sem);
00969 
00970         return rc;
00971 }
00972 
00973 static int fid_is_for_ostobj(const struct lu_env *env,
00974                              struct lfsck_instance *lfsck,
00975                              struct dt_object *obj, const struct lu_fid *fid)
00976 {
00977         struct seq_server_site  *ss     = lfsck_dev_site(lfsck);
00978         struct lu_seq_range     *range  = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_range;
00979         struct lustre_mdt_attrs *lma;
00980         int                      rc;
00981 
00982         fld_range_set_any(range);
00983         rc = fld_server_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld, fid_seq(fid), range);
00984         if (rc == 0) {
00985                 if (fld_range_is_ost(range))
00986                         return 1;
00987 
00988                 return 0;
00989         }
00990 
00991         lma = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lma;
00992         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, obj, lfsck_buf_get(env, lma, sizeof(*lma)),
00993                           XATTR_NAME_LMA);
00994         if (rc == sizeof(*lma)) {
00995                 lustre_lma_swab(lma);
00996 
00997                 return lma->lma_compat & LMAC_FID_ON_OST ? 1 : 0;
00998         }
00999 
01000         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, obj, &LU_BUF_NULL, XATTR_NAME_FID);
01001 
01002         return rc > 0;
01003 }
01004 
01005 static struct lfsck_layout_seq *
01006 lfsck_layout_seq_lookup(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd, __u64 seq)
01007 {
01008         struct lfsck_layout_seq *lls;
01009 
01010         list_for_each_entry(lls, &llsd->llsd_seq_list, lls_list) {
01011                 if (lls->lls_seq == seq)
01012                         return lls;
01013 
01014                 if (lls->lls_seq > seq)
01015                         return NULL;
01016         }
01017 
01018         return NULL;
01019 }
01020 
01021 static void
01022 lfsck_layout_seq_insert(struct lfsck_layout_slave_data *llsd,
01023                         struct lfsck_layout_seq *lls)
01024 {
01025         struct lfsck_layout_seq *tmp;
01026         struct list_head        *pos = &llsd->llsd_seq_list;
01027 
01028         list_for_each_entry(tmp, &llsd->llsd_seq_list, lls_list) {
01029                 if (lls->lls_seq < tmp->lls_seq) {
01030                         pos = &tmp->lls_list;
01031                         break;
01032                 }
01033         }
01034         list_add_tail(&lls->lls_list, pos);
01035 }
01036 
01037 static int
01038 lfsck_layout_lastid_create(const struct lu_env *env,
01039                            struct lfsck_instance *lfsck,
01040                            struct dt_object *obj)
01041 {
01042         struct lfsck_thread_info *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01043         struct lu_attr           *la     = &info->lti_la;
01044         struct dt_object_format  *dof    = &info->lti_dof;
01045         struct lfsck_bookmark    *bk     = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
01046         struct dt_device         *dt     = lfsck_obj2dev(obj);
01047         struct thandle           *th;
01048         __u64                     lastid = 0;
01049         loff_t                    pos    = 0;
01050         int                       rc;
01051         ENTRY;
01052 
01053         if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
01054                 return 0;
01055 
01056         memset(la, 0, sizeof(*la));
01057         la->la_mode = S_IFREG |  S_IRUGO | S_IWUSR;
01058         la->la_valid = LA_MODE | LA_UID | LA_GID;
01059         memset(dof, 0, sizeof(*dof));
01060         dof->dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
01061 
01062         th = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
01063         if (IS_ERR(th))
01064                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
01065 
01066         rc = dt_declare_create(env, obj, la, NULL, dof, th);
01067         if (rc != 0)
01068                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01069 
01070         rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, obj,
01071                                      lfsck_buf_get(env, &lastid,
01072                                                    sizeof(lastid)),
01073                                      pos, th);
01074         if (rc != 0)
01075                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01076 
01077         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dt, th);
01078         if (rc != 0)
01079                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01080 
01081         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
01082         if (likely(dt_object_exists(obj) == 0)) {
01083                 rc = dt_create(env, obj, la, NULL, dof, th);
01084                 if (rc == 0)
01085                         rc = dt_record_write(env, obj,
01086                                 lfsck_buf_get(env, &lastid, sizeof(lastid)),
01087                                 &pos, th);
01088         }
01089         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
01090 
01091         GOTO(stop, rc);
01092 
01093 stop:
01094         dt_trans_stop(env, dt, th);
01095 
01096 log:
01097         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK will create LAST_ID for <seq> "
01098                LPX64": rc = %d\n",
01099                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), fid_seq(lfsck_dto2fid(obj)), rc);
01100 
01101         return rc;
01102 }
01103 
01104 static int
01105 lfsck_layout_lastid_reload(const struct lu_env *env,
01106                            struct lfsck_component *com,
01107                            struct lfsck_layout_seq *lls)
01108 {
01109         __u64   lastid;
01110         loff_t  pos     = 0;
01111         int     rc;
01112 
01113         dt_read_lock(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj, 0);
01114         rc = dt_record_read(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj,
01115                             lfsck_buf_get(env, &lastid, sizeof(lastid)), &pos);
01116         dt_read_unlock(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj);
01117         if (unlikely(rc != 0))
01118                 return rc;
01119 
01120         lastid = le64_to_cpu(lastid);
01121         if (lastid < lls->lls_lastid_known) {
01122                 struct lfsck_instance   *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01123                 struct lfsck_layout     *lo     = com->lc_file_ram;
01124 
01125                 lls->lls_lastid = lls->lls_lastid_known;
01126                 lls->lls_dirty = 1;
01127                 if (!(lo->ll_flags & LF_CRASHED_LASTID)) {
01128                         LASSERT(lfsck->li_out_notify != NULL);
01129 
01130                         lfsck->li_out_notify(env, lfsck->li_out_notify_data,
01131                                              LE_LASTID_REBUILDING);
01132                         lo->ll_flags |= LF_CRASHED_LASTID;
01133 
01134                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK finds crashed "
01135                                "LAST_ID file (1) for the sequence "LPX64
01136                                ", old value "LPU64", known value "LPU64"\n",
01137                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), lls->lls_seq,
01138                                lastid, lls->lls_lastid);
01139                 }
01140         } else if (lastid >= lls->lls_lastid) {
01141                 lls->lls_lastid = lastid;
01142                 lls->lls_dirty = 0;
01143         }
01144 
01145         return 0;
01146 }
01147 
01148 static int
01149 lfsck_layout_lastid_store(const struct lu_env *env,
01150                           struct lfsck_component *com)
01151 {
01152         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01153         struct lfsck_bookmark           *bk     = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
01154         struct dt_device                *dt     = lfsck->li_bottom;
01155         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data  *llsd   = com->lc_data;
01156         struct lfsck_layout_seq         *lls;
01157         struct thandle                  *th;
01158         __u64                            lastid;
01159         int                              rc     = 0;
01160         int                              rc1    = 0;
01161 
01162         list_for_each_entry(lls, &llsd->llsd_seq_list, lls_list) {
01163                 loff_t pos = 0;
01164 
01165                 if (!lls->lls_dirty)
01166                         continue;
01167 
01168                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK will sync the LAST_ID for "
01169                        "<seq> "LPX64" as <oid> "LPU64"\n",
01170                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), lls->lls_seq, lls->lls_lastid);
01171 
01172                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN) {
01173                         lls->lls_dirty = 0;
01174                         continue;
01175                 }
01176 
01177                 th = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
01178                 if (IS_ERR(th)) {
01179                         rc1 = PTR_ERR(th);
01180                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK failed to store "
01181                                "the LAST_ID for <seq> "LPX64"(1): rc = %d\n",
01182                                lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
01183                                lls->lls_seq, rc1);
01184                         continue;
01185                 }
01186 
01187                 lastid = cpu_to_le64(lls->lls_lastid);
01188                 rc = dt_declare_record_write(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj,
01189                                              lfsck_buf_get(env, &lastid,
01190                                                            sizeof(lastid)),
01191                                              pos, th);
01192                 if (rc != 0)
01193                         goto stop;
01194 
01195                 rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dt, th);
01196                 if (rc != 0)
01197                         goto stop;
01198 
01199                 dt_write_lock(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj, 0);
01200                 rc = dt_record_write(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj,
01201                                      lfsck_buf_get(env, &lastid,
01202                                      sizeof(lastid)), &pos, th);
01203                 dt_write_unlock(env, lls->lls_lastid_obj);
01204                 if (rc == 0)
01205                         lls->lls_dirty = 0;
01206 
01207 stop:
01208                 dt_trans_stop(env, dt, th);
01209                 if (rc != 0) {
01210                         rc1 = rc;
01211                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK failed to store "
01212                                "the LAST_ID for <seq> "LPX64"(2): rc = %d\n",
01213                                lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
01214                                lls->lls_seq, rc1);
01215                 }
01216         }
01217 
01218         return rc1;
01219 }
01220 
01221 static int
01222 lfsck_layout_lastid_load(const struct lu_env *env,
01223                          struct lfsck_component *com,
01224                          struct lfsck_layout_seq *lls)
01225 {
01226         struct lfsck_instance   *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01227         struct lfsck_layout     *lo     = com->lc_file_ram;
01228         struct lu_fid           *fid    = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_fid;
01229         struct dt_object        *obj;
01230         loff_t                   pos    = 0;
01231         int                      rc;
01232         ENTRY;
01233 
01234         lu_last_id_fid(fid, lls->lls_seq, lfsck_dev_idx(lfsck));
01235         obj = dt_locate(env, lfsck->li_bottom, fid);
01236         if (IS_ERR(obj))
01237                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obj));
01238 
01239         /* LAST_ID crashed, to be rebuilt */
01240         if (dt_object_exists(obj) == 0) {
01241                 if (!(lo->ll_flags & LF_CRASHED_LASTID)) {
01242                         LASSERT(lfsck->li_out_notify != NULL);
01243 
01244                         lfsck->li_out_notify(env, lfsck->li_out_notify_data,
01245                                              LE_LASTID_REBUILDING);
01246                         lo->ll_flags |= LF_CRASHED_LASTID;
01247 
01248                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK cannot find the "
01249                                "LAST_ID file for sequence "LPX64"\n",
01250                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), lls->lls_seq);
01251 
01252                         if (OBD_FAIL_CHECK(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_DELAY4) &&
01253                             cfs_fail_val > 0) {
01254                                 struct l_wait_info lwi = LWI_TIMEOUT(
01255                                                 cfs_time_seconds(cfs_fail_val),
01256                                                 NULL, NULL);
01257 
01258                                 /* Some others may changed the cfs_fail_val
01259                                  * as zero after above check, re-check it for
01260                                  * sure to avoid falling into wait for ever. */
01261                                 if (likely(lwi.lwi_timeout > 0)) {
01262                                         struct ptlrpc_thread *thread =
01263                                                 &lfsck->li_thread;
01264 
01265                                         up_write(&com->lc_sem);
01266                                         l_wait_event(thread->t_ctl_waitq,
01267                                                      !thread_is_running(thread),
01268                                                      &lwi);
01269                                         down_write(&com->lc_sem);
01270                                 }
01271                         }
01272                 }
01273 
01274                 rc = lfsck_layout_lastid_create(env, lfsck, obj);
01275         } else {
01276                 dt_read_lock(env, obj, 0);
01277                 rc = dt_read(env, obj,
01278                         lfsck_buf_get(env, &lls->lls_lastid, sizeof(__u64)),
01279                         &pos);
01280                 dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
01281                 if (rc != 0 && rc != sizeof(__u64))
01282                         GOTO(out, rc = (rc > 0 ? -EFAULT : rc));
01283 
01284                 if (rc == 0 && !(lo->ll_flags & LF_CRASHED_LASTID)) {
01285                         LASSERT(lfsck->li_out_notify != NULL);
01286 
01287                         lfsck->li_out_notify(env, lfsck->li_out_notify_data,
01288                                              LE_LASTID_REBUILDING);
01289                         lo->ll_flags |= LF_CRASHED_LASTID;
01290 
01291                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK finds invalid "
01292                                "LAST_ID file for the sequence "LPX64
01293                                ": rc = %d\n",
01294                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), lls->lls_seq, rc);
01295                 }
01296 
01297                 lls->lls_lastid = le64_to_cpu(lls->lls_lastid);
01298                 rc = 0;
01299         }
01300 
01301         GOTO(out, rc);
01302 
01303 out:
01304         if (rc != 0)
01305                 lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
01306         else
01307                 lls->lls_lastid_obj = obj;
01308 
01309         return rc;
01310 }
01311 
01312 static void lfsck_layout_record_failure(const struct lu_env *env,
01313                                         struct lfsck_instance *lfsck,
01314                                         struct lfsck_layout *lo)
01315 {
01316         __u64 cookie;
01317 
01318         lo->ll_objs_failed_phase1++;
01319         cookie = lfsck->li_obj_oit->do_index_ops->dio_it.store(env,
01320                                                         lfsck->li_di_oit);
01321         if (lo->ll_pos_first_inconsistent == 0 ||
01322             lo->ll_pos_first_inconsistent < cookie) {
01323                 lo->ll_pos_first_inconsistent = cookie;
01324 
01325                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK hit first non-repaired "
01326                        "inconsistency at the pos ["LPU64"]\n",
01327                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
01328                        lo->ll_pos_first_inconsistent);
01329         }
01330 }
01331 
01332 static int lfsck_layout_double_scan_result(const struct lu_env *env,
01333                                            struct lfsck_component *com,
01334                                            int rc)
01335 {
01336         struct lfsck_instance   *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
01337         struct lfsck_layout     *lo    = com->lc_file_ram;
01338 
01339         down_write(&com->lc_sem);
01340         lo->ll_run_time_phase2 += cfs_duration_sec(cfs_time_current() +
01341                                   HALF_SEC - com->lc_time_last_checkpoint);
01342         lo->ll_time_last_checkpoint = cfs_time_current_sec();
01343         lo->ll_objs_checked_phase2 += com->lc_new_checked;
01344 
01345         if (rc > 0) {
01346                 if (lo->ll_flags & LF_INCOMPLETE) {
01347                         lo->ll_status = LS_PARTIAL;
01348                 } else {
01349                         if (lfsck->li_master) {
01350                                 struct lfsck_assistant_data *lad = com->lc_data;
01351 
01352                                 if (lad->lad_incomplete)
01353                                         lo->ll_status = LS_PARTIAL;
01354                                 else
01355                                         lo->ll_status = LS_COMPLETED;
01356                         } else {
01357                                 lo->ll_status = LS_COMPLETED;
01358                         }
01359                 }
01360                 if (!(lfsck->li_bookmark_ram.lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN))
01361                         lo->ll_flags &= ~(LF_SCANNED_ONCE | LF_INCONSISTENT);
01362                 lo->ll_time_last_complete = lo->ll_time_last_checkpoint;
01363                 lo->ll_success_count++;
01364         } else if (rc == 0) {
01365                 if (lfsck->li_status != 0)
01366                         lo->ll_status = lfsck->li_status;
01367                 else
01368                         lo->ll_status = LS_STOPPED;
01369         } else {
01370                 lo->ll_status = LS_FAILED;
01371         }
01372 
01373         rc = lfsck_layout_store(env, com);
01374         up_write(&com->lc_sem);
01375 
01376         return rc;
01377 }
01378 
01379 static int lfsck_layout_trans_stop(const struct lu_env *env,
01380                                    struct dt_device *dev,
01381                                    struct thandle *handle, int result)
01382 {
01383         int rc;
01384 
01385         /* XXX: If there is something worng or it needs to repair nothing,
01386          *      then notify the lower to stop the modification. Currently,
01387          *      we use th_result for such purpose, that may be replaced by
01388          *      some rollback mechanism in the future. */
01389         handle->th_result = result;
01390         rc = dt_trans_stop(env, dev, handle);
01391         if (result != 0)
01392                 return result > 0 ? 0 : result;
01393 
01394         return rc == 0 ? 1 : rc;
01395 }
01396 
01407 static int lfsck_layout_get_def_stripesize(const struct lu_env *env,
01408                                            struct lfsck_instance *lfsck,
01409                                            __u32 *size)
01410 {
01411         struct lov_user_md      *lum = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lum;
01412         struct dt_object        *root;
01413         int                      rc;
01414 
01415         root = dt_locate(env, lfsck->li_next, &lfsck->li_local_root_fid);
01416         if (IS_ERR(root))
01417                 return PTR_ERR(root);
01418 
01419         /* Get the default stripe size via xattr_get on the backend root. */
01420         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, root, lfsck_buf_get(env, lum, sizeof(*lum)),
01421                           XATTR_NAME_LOV);
01422         if (rc > 0) {
01423                 /* The lum->lmm_stripe_size is LE mode. The *size also
01424                  * should be LE mode. So it is unnecessary to convert. */
01425                 *size = lum->lmm_stripe_size;
01426                 rc = 0;
01427         } else if (unlikely(rc == 0)) {
01428                 rc = -EINVAL;
01429         }
01430 
01431         lfsck_object_put(env, root);
01432 
01433         return rc;
01434 }
01435 
01441 static int lfsck_layout_refill_lovea(const struct lu_env *env,
01442                                      struct thandle *handle,
01443                                      struct dt_object *parent,
01444                                      struct lu_fid *cfid,
01445                                      struct lu_buf *buf,
01446                                      struct lov_ost_data_v1 *slot,
01447                                      int fl, __u32 ost_idx)
01448 {
01449         struct ost_id           *oi     = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_oi;
01450         struct lov_mds_md_v1    *lmm    = buf->lb_buf;
01451         struct lu_buf            ea_buf;
01452         int                      rc;
01453         __u32                    magic;
01454         __u16                    count;
01455         ENTRY;
01456 
01457         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
01458         count = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count);
01459 
01460         fid_to_ostid(cfid, oi);
01461         ostid_cpu_to_le(oi, &slot->l_ost_oi);
01462         slot->l_ost_gen = cpu_to_le32(0);
01463         slot->l_ost_idx = cpu_to_le32(ost_idx);
01464 
01465         if (le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_pattern) & LOV_PATTERN_F_HOLE) {
01466                 struct lov_ost_data_v1 *objs;
01467                 int                     i;
01468 
01469                 if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1)
01470                         objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[0];
01471                 else
01472                         objs = &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->lmm_objects[0];
01473                 for (i = 0; i < count; i++, objs++) {
01474                         if (objs != slot && lovea_slot_is_dummy(objs))
01475                                 break;
01476                 }
01477 
01478                 /* If the @slot is the last dummy slot to be refilled,
01479                  * then drop LOV_PATTERN_F_HOLE from lmm::lmm_pattern. */
01480                 if (i == count)
01481                         lmm->lmm_pattern &= ~cpu_to_le32(LOV_PATTERN_F_HOLE);
01482         }
01483 
01484         lfsck_buf_init(&ea_buf, lmm, lov_mds_md_size(count, magic));
01485         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, parent, &ea_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV, fl, handle);
01486         if (rc == 0)
01487                 rc = 1;
01488 
01489         RETURN(rc);
01490 }
01491 
01497 static int lfsck_layout_extend_lovea(const struct lu_env *env,
01498                                      struct lfsck_instance *lfsck,
01499                                      struct thandle *handle,
01500                                      struct dt_object *parent,
01501                                      struct lu_fid *cfid,
01502                                      struct lu_buf *buf, int fl,
01503                                      __u32 ost_idx, __u32 ea_off, bool reset)
01504 {
01505         struct lov_mds_md_v1    *lmm    = buf->lb_buf;
01506         struct lov_ost_data_v1  *objs;
01507         int                      rc;
01508         __u16                    count;
01509         bool                     hole   = false;
01510         ENTRY;
01511 
01512         if (fl == LU_XATTR_CREATE || reset) {
01513                 __u32 pattern = LOV_PATTERN_RAID0;
01514 
01515                 count = ea_off + 1;
01516                 LASSERT(buf->lb_len >= lov_mds_md_size(count, LOV_MAGIC_V1));
01517 
01518                 if (ea_off != 0 || reset) {
01519                         pattern |= LOV_PATTERN_F_HOLE;
01520                         hole = true;
01521                 }
01522 
01523                 memset(lmm, 0, buf->lb_len);
01524                 lmm->lmm_magic = cpu_to_le32(LOV_MAGIC_V1);
01525                 lmm->lmm_pattern = cpu_to_le32(pattern);
01526                 fid_to_lmm_oi(lfsck_dto2fid(parent), &lmm->lmm_oi);
01527                 lmm_oi_cpu_to_le(&lmm->lmm_oi, &lmm->lmm_oi);
01528 
01529                 rc = lfsck_layout_get_def_stripesize(env, lfsck,
01530                                                      &lmm->lmm_stripe_size);
01531                 if (rc != 0)
01532                         RETURN(rc);
01533 
01534                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[ea_off];
01535         } else {
01536                 __u32   magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
01537                 int     gap;
01538 
01539                 count = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count);
01540                 if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1)
01541                         objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[count];
01542                 else
01543                         objs = &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->
01544                                                         lmm_objects[count];
01545 
01546                 gap = ea_off - count;
01547                 if (gap >= 0)
01548                         count = ea_off + 1;
01549                 LASSERT(buf->lb_len >= lov_mds_md_size(count, magic));
01550 
01551                 if (gap > 0) {
01552                         memset(objs, 0, gap * sizeof(*objs));
01553                         lmm->lmm_pattern |= cpu_to_le32(LOV_PATTERN_F_HOLE);
01554                         hole = true;
01555                 }
01556 
01557                 lmm->lmm_layout_gen =
01558                             cpu_to_le16(le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_layout_gen) + 1);
01559                 objs += gap;
01560         }
01561 
01562         lmm->lmm_stripe_count = cpu_to_le16(count);
01563         rc = lfsck_layout_refill_lovea(env, handle, parent, cfid, buf, objs,
01564                                        fl, ost_idx);
01565 
01566         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant extend layout EA for "
01567                DFID": parent "DFID", OST-index %u, stripe-index %u, fl %d, "
01568                "reset %s, %s LOV EA hole: rc = %d\n",
01569                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(cfid), PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)),
01570                ost_idx, ea_off, fl, reset ? "yes" : "no",
01571                hole ? "with" : "without", rc);
01572 
01573         RETURN(rc);
01574 }
01575 
01576 static int __lfsck_layout_update_pfid(const struct lu_env *env,
01577                                       struct dt_object *child,
01578                                       const struct lu_fid *pfid, __u32 offset)
01579 {
01580         struct dt_device        *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(child);
01581         struct filter_fid       *ff     = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_new_pfid;
01582         struct thandle          *handle;
01583         struct lu_buf            buf    = { NULL };
01584         int                      rc;
01585 
01586         ff->ff_parent.f_seq = cpu_to_le64(pfid->f_seq);
01587         ff->ff_parent.f_oid = cpu_to_le32(pfid->f_oid);
01588         /* Currently, the filter_fid::ff_parent::f_ver is not the real parent
01589          * MDT-object's FID::f_ver, instead it is the OST-object index in its
01590          * parent MDT-object's layout EA. */
01591         ff->ff_parent.f_stripe_idx = cpu_to_le32(offset);
01592         lfsck_buf_init(&buf, ff, sizeof(struct filter_fid));
01593 
01594         handle = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
01595         if (IS_ERR(handle))
01596                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(handle));
01597 
01598         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, child, &buf, XATTR_NAME_FID, 0, handle);
01599         if (rc != 0)
01600                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01601 
01602         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, handle);
01603         if (rc != 0)
01604                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01605 
01606         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, child, &buf, XATTR_NAME_FID, 0, handle);
01607 
01608         GOTO(stop, rc);
01609 
01610 stop:
01611         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, handle);
01612 
01613         return rc;
01614 }
01615 
01621 static int lfsck_layout_update_pfid(const struct lu_env *env,
01622                                     struct lfsck_component *com,
01623                                     struct dt_object *parent,
01624                                     struct lu_fid *cfid,
01625                                     struct dt_device *cdev, __u32 ea_off)
01626 {
01627         struct dt_object        *child;
01628         int                      rc     = 0;
01629         ENTRY;
01630 
01631         child = lfsck_object_find_by_dev(env, cdev, cfid);
01632         if (IS_ERR(child))
01633                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(child));
01634 
01635         rc = __lfsck_layout_update_pfid(env, child,
01636                                         lu_object_fid(&parent->do_lu), ea_off);
01637         lfsck_object_put(env, child);
01638 
01639         RETURN(rc == 0 ? 1 : rc);
01640 }
01641 
01697 static int lfsck_layout_recreate_parent(const struct lu_env *env,
01698                                         struct lfsck_component *com,
01699                                         struct lfsck_tgt_desc *ltd,
01700                                         struct lu_orphan_rec *rec,
01701                                         struct lu_fid *cfid,
01702                                         const char *infix,
01703                                         const char *type,
01704                                         __u32 ea_off)
01705 {
01706         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01707         struct dt_insert_rec            *dtrec  = &info->lti_dt_rec;
01708         char                            *name   = info->lti_key;
01709         struct lu_attr                  *la     = &info->lti_la2;
01710         struct dt_object_format         *dof    = &info->lti_dof;
01711         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01712         struct lu_fid                   *pfid   = &rec->lor_fid;
01713         struct lu_fid                   *tfid   = &info->lti_fid3;
01714         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck->li_bottom;
01715         struct dt_object                *lpf    = lfsck->li_lpf_obj;
01716         struct dt_object                *pobj   = NULL;
01717         struct dt_object                *cobj   = NULL;
01718         struct thandle                  *th     = NULL;
01719         struct lu_buf                   *ea_buf = &info->lti_big_buf;
01720         struct lu_buf                    lov_buf;
01721         struct lfsck_lock_handle        *llh    = &info->lti_llh;
01722         struct linkea_data               ldata  = { NULL };
01723         struct lu_buf                    linkea_buf;
01724         const struct lu_name            *pname;
01725         int                              size   = 0;
01726         int                              idx    = 0;
01727         int                              rc     = 0;
01728         ENTRY;
01729 
01730         if (unlikely(lpf == NULL))
01731                 GOTO(log, rc = -ENXIO);
01732 
01733         /* We use two separated transactions to repair the inconsistency.
01734          *
01735          * 1) create the MDT-object locally.
01736          * 2) update the OST-object's PFID EA if necessary.
01737          *
01738          * If 1) succeed, but 2) failed, then the OST-object's PFID EA will be
01739          * updated when the layout LFSCK run next time.
01740          *
01741          * If 1) failed, but 2) succeed, then such MDT-object will be re-created
01742          * when the layout LFSCK run next time. */
01743 
01744         if (fid_is_zero(pfid)) {
01745                 rc = lfsck_fid_alloc(env, lfsck, pfid, false);
01746                 if (rc != 0)
01747                         GOTO(log, rc);
01748 
01749                 cobj = lfsck_object_find_by_dev(env, ltd->ltd_tgt, cfid);
01750                 if (IS_ERR(cobj))
01751                         GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(cobj));
01752         }
01753 
01754         pobj = lfsck_object_find_by_dev(env, dev, pfid);
01755         if (IS_ERR(pobj))
01756                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(pobj));
01757 
01758         LASSERT(infix != NULL);
01759         LASSERT(type != NULL);
01760 
01761         memset(la, 0, sizeof(*la));
01762         la->la_uid = rec->lor_uid;
01763         la->la_gid = rec->lor_gid;
01764         la->la_mode = S_IFREG | S_IRUSR;
01765         la->la_valid = LA_MODE | LA_UID | LA_GID;
01766 
01767         memset(dof, 0, sizeof(*dof));
01768         dof->dof_type = dt_mode_to_dft(S_IFREG);
01769         /* Because the dof->dof_reg.striped = 0, the LOD will not create
01770          * the stripe(s). The LFSCK will specify the LOV EA via
01771          * lfsck_layout_extend_lovea(). */
01772 
01773         size = lov_mds_md_size(ea_off + 1, LOV_MAGIC_V1);
01774         if (ea_buf->lb_len < size) {
01775                 lu_buf_realloc(ea_buf, size);
01776                 if (ea_buf->lb_buf == NULL)
01777                         GOTO(log, rc = -ENOMEM);
01778         }
01779 
01780 again:
01781         do {
01782                 snprintf(name, NAME_MAX, DFID"%s-%s-%d", PFID(pfid), infix,
01783                          type, idx++);
01784                 rc = dt_lookup(env, lfsck->li_lpf_obj, (struct dt_rec *)tfid,
01785                                (const struct dt_key *)name);
01786                 if (rc != 0 && rc != -ENOENT)
01787                         GOTO(log, rc);
01788         } while (rc == 0);
01789 
01790         rc = lfsck_lock(env, lfsck, lfsck->li_lpf_obj, name, llh,
01791                         MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE, LCK_PW);
01792         if (rc != 0)
01793                 GOTO(log, rc);
01794 
01795         /* Re-check whether the name conflict with othrs after taken
01796          * the ldlm lock. */
01797         rc = dt_lookup(env, lfsck->li_lpf_obj, (struct dt_rec *)tfid,
01798                        (const struct dt_key *)name);
01799         if (unlikely(rc == 0)) {
01800                 lfsck_unlock(llh);
01801                 goto again;
01802         }
01803 
01804         if (rc != -ENOENT)
01805                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
01806 
01807         rc = linkea_data_new(&ldata,
01808                              &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_linkea_buf);
01809         if (rc != 0)
01810                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
01811 
01812         pname = lfsck_name_get_const(env, name, strlen(name));
01813         rc = linkea_add_buf(&ldata, pname, lfsck_dto2fid(lfsck->li_lpf_obj));
01814         if (rc != 0)
01815                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
01816 
01817         /* The 1st transaction. */
01818         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
01819         if (IS_ERR(th))
01820                 GOTO(unlock, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
01821 
01822         rc = dt_declare_create(env, pobj, la, NULL, dof, th);
01823         if (rc != 0)
01824                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01825 
01826         lfsck_buf_init(&lov_buf, ea_buf->lb_buf, size);
01827         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, pobj, &lov_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
01828                                   LU_XATTR_REPLACE, th);
01829         if (rc != 0)
01830                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01831 
01832         dtrec->rec_fid = pfid;
01833         dtrec->rec_type = S_IFREG;
01834         rc = dt_declare_insert(env, lpf,
01835                                (const struct dt_rec *)dtrec,
01836                                (const struct dt_key *)name, th);
01837         if (rc != 0)
01838                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01839 
01840         lfsck_buf_init(&linkea_buf, ldata.ld_buf->lb_buf,
01841                        ldata.ld_leh->leh_len);
01842         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, pobj, &linkea_buf,
01843                                   XATTR_NAME_LINK, 0, th);
01844         if (rc != 0)
01845                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01846 
01847         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
01848         if (rc != 0)
01849                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01850 
01851         dt_write_lock(env, pobj, 0);
01852         rc = dt_create(env, pobj, la, NULL, dof, th);
01853         if (rc == 0)
01854                 rc = lfsck_layout_extend_lovea(env, lfsck, th, pobj, cfid,
01855                                 &lov_buf, 0, ltd->ltd_index, ea_off, true);
01856         dt_write_unlock(env, pobj);
01857         if (rc < 0)
01858                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01859 
01860         rc = dt_insert(env, lpf, (const struct dt_rec *)dtrec,
01861                        (const struct dt_key *)name, th, 1);
01862         if (rc != 0)
01863                 GOTO(stop, rc);
01864 
01865         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, pobj, &linkea_buf, XATTR_NAME_LINK, 0, th);
01866         if (rc == 0 && cobj != NULL) {
01867                 dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
01868                 th = NULL;
01869 
01870                 /* The 2nd transaction. */
01871                 rc = __lfsck_layout_update_pfid(env, cobj, pfid, ea_off);
01872         }
01873 
01874         GOTO(stop, rc);
01875 
01876 stop:
01877         if (th != NULL)
01878                 dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
01879 
01880 unlock:
01881         lfsck_unlock(llh);
01882 
01883 log:
01884         if (cobj != NULL && !IS_ERR(cobj))
01885                 lfsck_object_put(env, cobj);
01886         if (pobj != NULL && !IS_ERR(pobj))
01887                 lfsck_object_put(env, pobj);
01888 
01889         if (rc < 0)
01890                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s layout LFSCK assistant failed to "
01891                        "recreate the lost MDT-object: parent "DFID
01892                        ", child "DFID", OST-index %u, stripe-index %u, "
01893                        "infix %s, type %s: rc = %d\n",
01894                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(pfid), PFID(cfid),
01895                        ltd->ltd_index, ea_off, infix, type, rc);
01896 
01897         return rc >= 0 ? 1 : rc;
01898 }
01899 
01900 static int lfsck_layout_master_conditional_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
01901                                                    struct lfsck_component *com,
01902                                                    const struct lu_fid *fid,
01903                                                    __u32 index)
01904 {
01905         struct lfsck_thread_info *info  = lfsck_env_info(env);
01906         struct lfsck_request     *lr    = &info->lti_lr;
01907         struct lfsck_instance    *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
01908         struct lfsck_tgt_desc    *ltd;
01909         struct ptlrpc_request    *req;
01910         struct lfsck_request     *tmp;
01911         struct obd_export        *exp;
01912         int                       rc    = 0;
01913         ENTRY;
01914 
01915         ltd = lfsck_tgt_get(&lfsck->li_ost_descs, index);
01916         if (unlikely(ltd == NULL))
01917                 RETURN(-ENXIO);
01918 
01919         exp = ltd->ltd_exp;
01920         if (!(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK))
01921                 GOTO(put, rc = -EOPNOTSUPP);
01922 
01923         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_LFSCK_NOTIFY);
01924         if (req == NULL)
01925                 GOTO(put, rc = -ENOMEM);
01926 
01927         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, LFSCK_NOTIFY);
01928         if (rc != 0) {
01929                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
01930 
01931                 GOTO(put, rc);
01932         }
01933 
01934         memset(lr, 0, sizeof(*lr));
01935         lr->lr_event = LE_CONDITIONAL_DESTROY;
01936         lr->lr_active = LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT;
01937         lr->lr_fid = *fid;
01938 
01939         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
01940         *tmp = *lr;
01941         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
01942 
01943         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
01944         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
01945 
01946         GOTO(put, rc);
01947 
01948 put:
01949         lfsck_tgt_put(ltd);
01950 
01951         return rc;
01952 }
01953 
01954 static int lfsck_layout_slave_conditional_destroy(const struct lu_env *env,
01955                                                   struct lfsck_component *com,
01956                                                   struct lfsck_request *lr)
01957 {
01958         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
01959         struct lu_attr                  *la     = &info->lti_la;
01960         union ldlm_policy_data          *policy = &info->lti_policy;
01961         struct ldlm_res_id              *resid  = &info->lti_resid;
01962         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
01963         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck->li_bottom;
01964         struct lu_fid                   *fid    = &lr->lr_fid;
01965         struct dt_object                *obj;
01966         struct thandle                  *th     = NULL;
01967         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
01968         __u64                            flags  = 0;
01969         int                              rc     = 0;
01970         ENTRY;
01971 
01972         obj = lfsck_object_find_by_dev(env, dev, fid);
01973         if (IS_ERR(obj))
01974                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obj));
01975 
01976         dt_read_lock(env, obj, 0);
01977         if (dt_object_exists(obj) == 0 ||
01978             lfsck_is_dead_obj(obj)) {
01979                 dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
01980 
01981                 GOTO(put, rc = -ENOENT);
01982         }
01983 
01984         /* Get obj's attr without lock firstly. */
01985         rc = dt_attr_get(env, obj, la);
01986         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
01987         if (rc != 0)
01988                 GOTO(put, rc);
01989 
01990         if (likely(la->la_ctime != 0 || la->la_mode & S_ISUID))
01991                 GOTO(put, rc = -ETXTBSY);
01992 
01993         /* Acquire extent lock on [0, EOF] to sync with all possible written. */
01994         LASSERT(lfsck->li_namespace != NULL);
01995 
01996         memset(policy, 0, sizeof(*policy));
01997         policy->l_extent.end = OBD_OBJECT_EOF;
01998         ost_fid_build_resid(fid, resid);
01999         rc = ldlm_cli_enqueue_local(lfsck->li_namespace, resid, LDLM_EXTENT,
02000                                     policy, LCK_EX, &flags, ldlm_blocking_ast,
02001                                     ldlm_completion_ast, NULL, NULL, 0,
02002                                     LVB_T_NONE, NULL, &lh);
02003         if (rc != ELDLM_OK)
02004                 GOTO(put, rc = -EIO);
02005 
02006         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
02007         /* Get obj's attr within lock again. */
02008         rc = dt_attr_get(env, obj, la);
02009         if (rc != 0)
02010                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
02011 
02012         if (la->la_ctime != 0)
02013                 GOTO(unlock, rc = -ETXTBSY);
02014 
02015         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
02016         if (IS_ERR(th))
02017                 GOTO(unlock, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
02018 
02019         rc = dt_declare_ref_del(env, obj, th);
02020         if (rc != 0)
02021                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02022 
02023         rc = dt_declare_destroy(env, obj, th);
02024         if (rc != 0)
02025                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02026 
02027         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
02028         if (rc != 0)
02029                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02030 
02031         rc = dt_ref_del(env, obj, th);
02032         if (rc != 0)
02033                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02034 
02035         rc = dt_destroy(env, obj, th);
02036         if (rc == 0)
02037                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK destroyed the empty "
02038                        "OST-object "DFID" that was created for reparing "
02039                        "dangling referenced case. But the original missing "
02040                        "OST-object is found now.\n",
02041                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(fid));
02042 
02043         GOTO(stop, rc);
02044 
02045 stop:
02046         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
02047 
02048 unlock:
02049         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
02050         ldlm_lock_decref(&lh, LCK_EX);
02051 
02052 put:
02053         lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
02054 
02055         return rc;
02056 }
02057 
02071 static int lfsck_layout_conflict_create(const struct lu_env *env,
02072                                         struct lfsck_component *com,
02073                                         struct lfsck_tgt_desc *ltd,
02074                                         struct lu_orphan_rec *rec,
02075                                         struct dt_object *parent,
02076                                         struct lu_fid *cfid,
02077                                         struct lu_buf *ea_buf,
02078                                         struct lov_ost_data_v1 *slot,
02079                                         __u32 ea_off)
02080 {
02081         struct lfsck_thread_info *info          = lfsck_env_info(env);
02082         struct lu_fid            *cfid2         = &info->lti_fid2;
02083         struct ost_id            *oi            = &info->lti_oi;
02084         struct lov_mds_md_v1     *lmm           = ea_buf->lb_buf;
02085         struct dt_device         *dev           = lfsck_obj2dev(parent);
02086         struct thandle           *th            = NULL;
02087         struct lustre_handle      lh            = { 0 };
02088         __u32                     ost_idx2      = le32_to_cpu(slot->l_ost_idx);
02089         int                       rc            = 0;
02090         ENTRY;
02091
