02092         ostid_le_to_cpu(&slot->l_ost_oi, oi);
02093         rc = ostid_to_fid(cfid2, oi, ost_idx2);
02094         if (rc != 0)
02095                 GOTO(out, rc);
02096 
02097         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, com->lc_lfsck, parent, &lh,
02098                               MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
02099                               LCK_EX);
02100         if (rc != 0)
02101                 GOTO(out, rc);
02102 
02103         rc = lfsck_layout_master_conditional_destroy(env, com, cfid2, ost_idx2);
02104 
02105         /* If the conflict OST-obejct is not created for fixing dangling
02106          * referenced MDT-object in former LFSCK check/repair, or it has
02107          * been modified by others, then we cannot destroy it. Re-create
02108          * a new MDT-object for the orphan OST-object. */
02109         if (rc == -ETXTBSY) {
02110                 /* No need the layout lock on the original parent. */
02111                 lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02112 
02113                 fid_zero(&rec->lor_fid);
02114                 snprintf(info->lti_tmpbuf, sizeof(info->lti_tmpbuf),
02115                          "-"DFID"-%x", PFID(lu_object_fid(&parent->do_lu)),
02116                          ea_off);
02117                 rc = lfsck_layout_recreate_parent(env, com, ltd, rec, cfid,
02118                                                 info->lti_tmpbuf, "C", ea_off);
02119 
02120                 RETURN(rc);
02121         }
02122 
02123         if (rc != 0 && rc != -ENOENT)
02124                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
02125 
02126         th = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
02127         if (IS_ERR(th))
02128                 GOTO(unlock, rc = PTR_ERR(th));
02129 
02130         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, parent, ea_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
02131                                   LU_XATTR_REPLACE, th);
02132         if (rc != 0)
02133                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02134 
02135         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, th);
02136         if (rc != 0)
02137                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02138 
02139         dt_write_lock(env, parent, 0);
02140         lmm->lmm_layout_gen = cpu_to_le16(le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_layout_gen) + 1);
02141         rc = lfsck_layout_refill_lovea(env, th, parent, cfid, ea_buf, slot,
02142                                        LU_XATTR_REPLACE, ltd->ltd_index);
02143         dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02144 
02145         GOTO(stop, rc);
02146 
02147 stop:
02148         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, th);
02149 
02150 unlock:
02151         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02152 
02153 out:
02154         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant replaced the conflict "
02155                "OST-object "DFID" on the OST %x with the orphan "DFID" on "
02156                "the OST %x: parent "DFID", stripe-index %u: rc = %d\n",
02157                lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck), PFID(cfid2), ost_idx2,
02158                PFID(cfid), ltd->ltd_index, PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)),
02159                ea_off, rc);
02160 
02161         return rc >= 0 ? 1 : rc;
02162 }
02163 
02169 static int lfsck_layout_recreate_lovea(const struct lu_env *env,
02170                                        struct lfsck_component *com,
02171                                        struct lfsck_tgt_desc *ltd,
02172                                        struct lu_orphan_rec *rec,
02173                                        struct dt_object *parent,
02174                                        struct lu_fid *cfid,
02175                                        __u32 ost_idx, __u32 ea_off)
02176 {
02177         struct lfsck_thread_info *info          = lfsck_env_info(env);
02178         struct lu_buf            *buf           = &info->lti_big_buf;
02179         struct lu_fid            *fid           = &info->lti_fid2;
02180         struct ost_id            *oi            = &info->lti_oi;
02181         struct lfsck_instance    *lfsck         = com->lc_lfsck;
02182         struct dt_device         *dt            = lfsck_obj2dev(parent);
02183         struct lfsck_bookmark    *bk            = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
02184         struct thandle            *handle       = NULL;
02185         size_t                    lovea_size;
02186         struct lov_mds_md_v1     *lmm;
02187         struct lov_ost_data_v1   *objs;
02188         struct lustre_handle      lh            = { 0 };
02189         __u32                     magic;
02190         int                       fl            = 0;
02191         int                       rc            = 0;
02192         int                       rc1;
02193         int                       i;
02194         __u16                     count;
02195         bool                      locked        = false;
02196         ENTRY;
02197 
02198         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, lfsck, parent, &lh,
02199                               MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
02200                               LCK_EX);
02201         if (rc != 0) {
02202                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant failed to recreate "
02203                        "LOV EA for "DFID": parent "DFID", OST-index %u, "
02204                        "stripe-index %u: rc = %d\n",
02205                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(cfid),
02206                        PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)), ost_idx, ea_off, rc);
02207 
02208                 RETURN(rc);
02209         }
02210 
02211 again:
02212         if (locked) {
02213                 dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02214                 locked = false;
02215         }
02216 
02217         if (handle != NULL) {
02218                 dt_trans_stop(env, dt, handle);
02219                 handle = NULL;
02220         }
02221 
02222         if (rc < 0)
02223                 GOTO(unlock_layout, rc);
02224 
02225         lovea_size = rc;
02226         if (buf->lb_len < lovea_size) {
02227                 lu_buf_realloc(buf, lovea_size);
02228                 if (buf->lb_buf == NULL)
02229                         GOTO(unlock_layout, rc = -ENOMEM);
02230         }
02231 
02232         if (!(bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)) {
02233                 handle = dt_trans_create(env, dt);
02234                 if (IS_ERR(handle))
02235                         GOTO(unlock_layout, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
02236 
02237                 rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, parent, buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
02238                                           fl, handle);
02239                 if (rc != 0)
02240                         GOTO(stop, rc);
02241 
02242                 rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dt, handle);
02243                 if (rc != 0)
02244                         GOTO(stop, rc);
02245         }
02246 
02247         dt_write_lock(env, parent, 0);
02248         locked = true;
02249         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, parent, buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV);
02250         if (rc == -ERANGE) {
02251                 rc = dt_xattr_get(env, parent, &LU_BUF_NULL, XATTR_NAME_LOV);
02252                 LASSERT(rc != 0);
02253                 goto again;
02254         } else if (rc == -ENODATA || rc == 0) {
02255                 lovea_size = lov_mds_md_size(ea_off + 1, LOV_MAGIC_V1);
02256                 /* If the declared is not big enough, re-try. */
02257                 if (buf->lb_len < lovea_size) {
02258                         rc = lovea_size;
02259                         goto again;
02260                 }
02261                 fl = LU_XATTR_CREATE;
02262         } else if (rc < 0) {
02263                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc);
02264         } else if (unlikely(buf->lb_len == 0)) {
02265                 goto again;
02266         } else {
02267                 fl = LU_XATTR_REPLACE;
02268                 lovea_size = rc;
02269         }
02270 
02271         if (fl == LU_XATTR_CREATE) {
02272                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
02273                         GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 1);
02274 
02275                 LASSERT(buf->lb_len >= lovea_size);
02276 
02277                 rc = lfsck_layout_extend_lovea(env, lfsck, handle, parent, cfid,
02278                                                buf, fl, ost_idx, ea_off, false);
02279 
02280                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc);
02281         }
02282 
02283         lmm = buf->lb_buf;
02284         rc1 = lfsck_layout_verify_header(lmm);
02285 
02286         /* If the LOV EA crashed, the rebuild it. */
02287         if (rc1 == -EINVAL) {
02288                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
02289                         GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 1);
02290 
02291                 LASSERT(buf->lb_len >= lovea_size);
02292 
02293                 rc = lfsck_layout_extend_lovea(env, lfsck, handle, parent, cfid,
02294                                                buf, fl, ost_idx, ea_off, true);
02295 
02296                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc);
02297         }
02298 
02299         /* For other unknown magic/pattern, keep the current LOV EA. */
02300         if (rc1 != 0)
02301                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = rc1);
02302 
02303         /* Currently, we only support LOV_MAGIC_V1/LOV_MAGIC_V3 which has
02304          * been verified in lfsck_layout_verify_header() already. If some
02305          * new magic introduced in the future, then layout LFSCK needs to
02306          * be updated also. */
02307         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
02308         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1) {
02309                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[0];
02310         } else {
02311                 LASSERT(magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3);
02312                 objs = &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->lmm_objects[0];
02313         }
02314 
02315         count = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count);
02316         if (count == 0)
02317                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = -EINVAL);
02318         LASSERT(count > 0);
02319 
02320         /* Exceed the current end of MDT-object layout EA. Then extend it. */
02321         if (count <= ea_off) {
02322                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
02323                         GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 1);
02324 
02325                 lovea_size = lov_mds_md_size(ea_off + 1, magic);
02326                 /* If the declared is not big enough, re-try. */
02327                 if (buf->lb_len < lovea_size) {
02328                         rc = lovea_size;
02329                         goto again;
02330                 }
02331 
02332                 rc = lfsck_layout_extend_lovea(env, lfsck, handle, parent, cfid,
02333                                                buf, fl, ost_idx, ea_off, false);
02334 
02335                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc);
02336         }
02337 
02338         LASSERTF(rc > 0, "invalid rc = %d\n", rc);
02339 
02340         for (i = 0; i < count; i++, objs++) {
02341                 /* The MDT-object was created via lfsck_layout_recover_create()
02342                  * by others before, and we fill the dummy layout EA. */
02343                 if (lovea_slot_is_dummy(objs)) {
02344                         if (i != ea_off)
02345                                 continue;
02346 
02347                         if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
02348                                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 1);
02349 
02350                         lmm->lmm_layout_gen =
02351                             cpu_to_le16(le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_layout_gen) + 1);
02352                         rc = lfsck_layout_refill_lovea(env, handle, parent,
02353                                                        cfid, buf, objs, fl,
02354                                                        ost_idx);
02355 
02356                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s layout LFSCK assistant fill "
02357                                "dummy layout slot for "DFID": parent "DFID
02358                                ", OST-index %u, stripe-index %u: rc = %d\n",
02359                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(cfid),
02360                                PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)), ost_idx, i, rc);
02361 
02362                         GOTO(unlock_parent, rc);
02363                 }
02364 
02365                 ostid_le_to_cpu(&objs->l_ost_oi, oi);
02366                 rc = ostid_to_fid(fid, oi, le32_to_cpu(objs->l_ost_idx));
02367                 if (rc != 0) {
02368                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: the parent "DFID" contains "
02369                                "invalid layout EA at the slot %d, index %u\n",
02370                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
02371                                PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)), i,
02372                                le32_to_cpu(objs->l_ost_idx));
02373 
02374                         GOTO(unlock_parent, rc);
02375                 }
02376 
02377                 /* It should be rare case, the slot is there, but the LFSCK
02378                  * does not handle it during the first-phase cycle scanning. */
02379                 if (unlikely(lu_fid_eq(fid, cfid))) {
02380                         if (i == ea_off) {
02381                                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 0);
02382                         } else {
02383                                 /* Rare case that the OST-object index
02384                                  * does not match the parent MDT-object
02385                                  * layout EA. We trust the later one. */
02386                                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
02387                                         GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 1);
02388 
02389                                 dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02390                                 if (handle != NULL)
02391                                         dt_trans_stop(env, dt, handle);
02392                                 lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02393                                 rc = lfsck_layout_update_pfid(env, com, parent,
02394                                                         cfid, ltd->ltd_tgt, i);
02395 
02396                                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s layout LFSCK assistant "
02397                                        "updated OST-object's pfid for "DFID
02398                                        ": parent "DFID", OST-index %u, "
02399                                        "stripe-index %u: rc = %d\n",
02400                                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(cfid),
02401                                        PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)),
02402                                        ltd->ltd_index, i, rc);
02403 
02404                                 RETURN(rc);
02405                         }
02406                 }
02407         }
02408 
02409         /* The MDT-object exists, but related layout EA slot is occupied
02410          * by others. */
02411         if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
02412                 GOTO(unlock_parent, rc = 1);
02413 
02414         dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02415         if (handle != NULL)
02416                 dt_trans_stop(env, dt, handle);
02417         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02418         if (le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic) == LOV_MAGIC_V1)
02419                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[ea_off];
02420         else
02421                 objs = &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->lmm_objects[ea_off];
02422         rc = lfsck_layout_conflict_create(env, com, ltd, rec, parent, cfid,
02423                                           buf, objs, ea_off);
02424 
02425         RETURN(rc);
02426 
02427 unlock_parent:
02428         if (locked)
02429                 dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02430 
02431 stop:
02432         if (handle != NULL)
02433                 dt_trans_stop(env, dt, handle);
02434 
02435 unlock_layout:
02436         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02437 
02438         return rc;
02439 }
02440 
02441 static int lfsck_layout_scan_orphan_one(const struct lu_env *env,
02442                                         struct lfsck_component *com,
02443                                         struct lfsck_tgt_desc *ltd,
02444                                         struct lu_orphan_rec *rec,
02445                                         struct lu_fid *cfid)
02446 {
02447         struct lfsck_layout     *lo     = com->lc_file_ram;
02448         struct lu_fid           *pfid   = &rec->lor_fid;
02449         struct dt_object        *parent = NULL;
02450         __u32                    ea_off = pfid->f_stripe_idx;
02451         int                      rc     = 0;
02452         ENTRY;
02453 
02454         if (!fid_is_sane(cfid))
02455                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
02456 
02457         if (fid_is_zero(pfid)) {
02458                 rc = lfsck_layout_recreate_parent(env, com, ltd, rec, cfid,
02459                                                   "", "N", ea_off);
02460                 GOTO(out, rc);
02461         }
02462 
02463         pfid->f_ver = 0;
02464         if (!fid_is_sane(pfid))
02465                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
02466 
02467         parent = lfsck_object_find_by_dev(env, com->lc_lfsck->li_bottom, pfid);
02468         if (IS_ERR(parent))
02469                 GOTO(out, rc = PTR_ERR(parent));
02470 
02471         if (unlikely(dt_object_remote(parent) != 0))
02472                 GOTO(put, rc = -EXDEV);
02473 
02474         if (dt_object_exists(parent) == 0) {
02475                 lfsck_object_put(env, parent);
02476                 rc = lfsck_layout_recreate_parent(env, com, ltd, rec, cfid,
02477                                                   "", "R", ea_off);
02478                 GOTO(out, rc);
02479         }
02480 
02481         if (!S_ISREG(lu_object_attr(&parent->do_lu)))
02482                 GOTO(put, rc = -EISDIR);
02483 
02484         rc = lfsck_layout_recreate_lovea(env, com, ltd, rec, parent, cfid,
02485                                          ltd->ltd_index, ea_off);
02486 
02487         GOTO(put, rc);
02488 
02489 put:
02490         if (rc <= 0)
02491                 lfsck_object_put(env, parent);
02492         else
02493                 /* The layout EA is changed, need to be reloaded next time. */
02494                 lu_object_put_nocache(env, &parent->do_lu);
02495 
02496 out:
02497         down_write(&com->lc_sem);
02498         com->lc_new_scanned++;
02499         com->lc_new_checked++;
02500         if (rc > 0) {
02501                 lo->ll_objs_repaired[LLIT_ORPHAN - 1]++;
02502                 rc = 0;
02503         } else if (rc < 0) {
02504                 lo->ll_objs_failed_phase2++;
02505         }
02506         up_write(&com->lc_sem);
02507 
02508         return rc;
02509 }
02510 
02511 static int lfsck_layout_scan_orphan(const struct lu_env *env,
02512                                     struct lfsck_component *com,
02513                                     struct lfsck_tgt_desc *ltd)
02514 {
02515         struct lfsck_assistant_data     *lad    = com->lc_data;
02516         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
02517         struct lfsck_bookmark           *bk     = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
02518         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
02519         struct ost_id                   *oi     = &info->lti_oi;
02520         struct lu_fid                   *fid    = &info->lti_fid;
02521         struct dt_object                *obj;
02522         const struct dt_it_ops          *iops;
02523         struct dt_it                    *di;
02524         int                              rc     = 0;
02525         ENTRY;
02526 
02527         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant starts the orphan "
02528                "scanning for OST%04x\n",
02529                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), ltd->ltd_index);
02530 
02531         if (cfs_bitmap_check(lad->lad_bitmap, ltd->ltd_index)) {
02532                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant skip the orphan "
02533                        "scanning for OST%04x\n",
02534                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), ltd->ltd_index);
02535 
02536                 RETURN(0);
02537         }
02538 
02539         ostid_set_seq(oi, FID_SEQ_IDIF);
02540         ostid_set_id(oi, 0);
02541         rc = ostid_to_fid(fid, oi, ltd->ltd_index);
02542         if (rc != 0)
02543                 GOTO(log, rc);
02544 
02545         obj = lfsck_object_find_by_dev(env, ltd->ltd_tgt, fid);
02546         if (unlikely(IS_ERR(obj)))
02547                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(obj));
02548 
02549         rc = obj->do_ops->do_index_try(env, obj, &dt_lfsck_orphan_features);
02550         if (rc != 0)
02551                 GOTO(put, rc);
02552 
02553         iops = &obj->do_index_ops->dio_it;
02554         di = iops->init(env, obj, 0);
02555         if (IS_ERR(di))
02556                 GOTO(put, rc = PTR_ERR(di));
02557 
02558         rc = iops->load(env, di, 0);
02559         if (rc == -ESRCH) {
02560                 /* -ESRCH means that the orphan OST-objects rbtree has been
02561                  * cleanup because of the OSS server restart or other errors. */
02562                 lfsck_lad_set_bitmap(env, com, ltd->ltd_index);
02563                 GOTO(fini, rc);
02564         }
02565 
02566         if (rc == 0)
02567                 rc = iops->next(env, di);
02568         else if (rc > 0)
02569                 rc = 0;
02570 
02571         if (rc < 0)
02572                 GOTO(fini, rc);
02573 
02574         if (rc > 0)
02575                 GOTO(fini, rc = 0);
02576 
02577         do {
02578                 struct dt_key           *key;
02579                 struct lu_orphan_rec    *rec = &info->lti_rec;
02580 
02581                 if (CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_DELAY3, cfs_fail_val) &&
02582                     unlikely(!thread_is_running(&lfsck->li_thread)))
02583                         break;
02584 
02585                 key = iops->key(env, di);
02586                 com->lc_fid_latest_scanned_phase2 = *(struct lu_fid *)key;
02587                 rc = iops->rec(env, di, (struct dt_rec *)rec, 0);
02588                 if (rc == 0)
02589                         rc = lfsck_layout_scan_orphan_one(env, com, ltd, rec,
02590                                         &com->lc_fid_latest_scanned_phase2);
02591                 if (rc != 0 && bk->lb_param & LPF_FAILOUT)
02592                         GOTO(fini, rc);
02593 
02594                 lfsck_control_speed_by_self(com);
02595                 do {
02596                         rc = iops->next(env, di);
02597                 } while (rc < 0 && !(bk->lb_param & LPF_FAILOUT));
02598         } while (rc == 0);
02599 
02600         GOTO(fini, rc);
02601 
02602 fini:
02603         iops->put(env, di);
02604         iops->fini(env, di);
02605 put:
02606         lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
02607 
02608 log:
02609         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant finished the orphan "
02610                "scanning for OST%04x: rc = %d\n",
02611                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), ltd->ltd_index, rc);
02612 
02613         return rc > 0 ? 0 : rc;
02614 }
02615 
02616 /* For the MDT-object with dangling reference, we need to repare the
02617  * inconsistency according to the LFSCK sponsor's requirement:
02618  *
02619  * 1) Keep the inconsistency there and report the inconsistency case,
02620  *    then give the chance to the application to find related issues,
02621  *    and the users can make the decision about how to handle it with
02622  *    more human knownledge. (by default)
02623  *
02624  * 2) Re-create the missing OST-object with the FID/owner information. */
02625 static int lfsck_layout_repair_dangling(const struct lu_env *env,
02626                                         struct lfsck_component *com,
02627                                         struct dt_object *parent,
02628                                         struct lfsck_layout_req *llr,
02629                                         struct lu_attr *la)
02630 {
02631         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
02632         struct filter_fid               *pfid   = &info->lti_new_pfid;
02633         struct dt_object_format         *dof    = &info->lti_dof;
02634         struct dt_object                *child  = llr->llr_child;
02635         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(child);
02636         const struct lu_fid             *tfid   = lu_object_fid(&parent->do_lu);
02637         struct thandle                  *handle;
02638         struct lu_buf                   *buf;
02639         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
02640         int                              rc;
02641         bool                             create;
02642         ENTRY;
02643 
02644         if (com->lc_lfsck->li_bookmark_ram.lb_param & LPF_CREATE_OSTOBJ)
02645                 create = true;
02646         else
02647                 create = false;
02648 
02649         if (!create)
02650                 GOTO(log, rc = 1);
02651 
02652         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, com->lc_lfsck, parent, &lh,
02653                               MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
02654                               LCK_EX);
02655         if (rc != 0)
02656                 GOTO(log, rc);
02657 
02658         rc = dt_attr_get(env, parent, la);
02659         if (rc != 0)
02660                 GOTO(unlock1, rc);
02661 
02662         la->la_mode = S_IFREG | 0666;
02663         la->la_atime = la->la_mtime = la->la_ctime = 0;
02664         la->la_valid = LA_TYPE | LA_MODE | LA_UID | LA_GID |
02665                        LA_ATIME | LA_MTIME | LA_CTIME;
02666         memset(dof, 0, sizeof(*dof));
02667         pfid->ff_parent.f_seq = cpu_to_le64(tfid->f_seq);
02668         pfid->ff_parent.f_oid = cpu_to_le32(tfid->f_oid);
02669         /* Currently, the filter_fid::ff_parent::f_ver is not the real parent
02670          * MDT-object's FID::f_ver, instead it is the OST-object index in its
02671          * parent MDT-object's layout EA. */
02672         pfid->ff_parent.f_stripe_idx = cpu_to_le32(llr->llr_lov_idx);
02673         buf = lfsck_buf_get(env, pfid, sizeof(struct filter_fid));
02674 
02675         handle = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
02676         if (IS_ERR(handle))
02677                 GOTO(unlock1, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
02678 
02679         rc = dt_declare_create(env, child, la, NULL, dof, handle);
02680         if (rc != 0)
02681                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02682 
02683         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, child, buf, XATTR_NAME_FID,
02684                                   LU_XATTR_CREATE, handle);
02685         if (rc != 0)
02686                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02687 
02688         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, handle);
02689         if (rc != 0)
02690                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02691 
02692         dt_read_lock(env, parent, 0);
02693         if (unlikely(lfsck_is_dead_obj(parent)))
02694                 GOTO(unlock2, rc = 1);
02695 
02696         rc = dt_create(env, child, la, NULL, dof, handle);
02697         if (rc != 0)
02698                 GOTO(unlock2, rc);
02699 
02700         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, child, buf, XATTR_NAME_FID, LU_XATTR_CREATE,
02701                           handle);
02702 
02703         GOTO(unlock2, rc);
02704 
02705 unlock2:
02706         dt_read_unlock(env, parent);
02707 
02708 stop:
02709         rc = lfsck_layout_trans_stop(env, dev, handle, rc);
02710 
02711 unlock1:
02712         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02713 
02714 log:
02715         if (rc != 0)
02716                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant found "
02717                        "dangling reference for: parent "DFID", child "DFID
02718                        ", OST-index %u, stripe-index %u, owner %u/%u. %s: "
02719                        "rc = %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
02720                        PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)), PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(child)),
02721                        llr->llr_ost_idx, llr->llr_lov_idx,
02722                        la->la_uid, la->la_gid,
02723                        create ? "Create the lost OST-object as required" :
02724                                 "Keep the MDT-object there by default", rc);
02725 
02726         return rc;
02727 }
02728 
02729 /* If the OST-object does not recognize the MDT-object as its parent, and
02730  * there is no other MDT-object claims as its parent, then just trust the
02731  * given MDT-object as its parent. So update the OST-object filter_fid. */
02732 static int lfsck_layout_repair_unmatched_pair(const struct lu_env *env,
02733                                               struct lfsck_component *com,
02734                                               struct dt_object *parent,
02735                                               struct lfsck_layout_req *llr,
02736                                               struct lu_attr *la)
02737 {
02738         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
02739         struct filter_fid               *pfid   = &info->lti_new_pfid;
02740         struct dt_object                *child  = llr->llr_child;
02741         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(child);
02742         const struct lu_fid             *tfid   = lu_object_fid(&parent->do_lu);
02743         struct thandle                  *handle;
02744         struct lu_buf                   *buf;
02745         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
02746         int                              rc;
02747         ENTRY;
02748 
02749         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, com->lc_lfsck, parent, &lh,
02750                               MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
02751                               LCK_EX);
02752         if (rc != 0)
02753                 GOTO(log, rc);
02754 
02755         pfid->ff_parent.f_seq = cpu_to_le64(tfid->f_seq);
02756         pfid->ff_parent.f_oid = cpu_to_le32(tfid->f_oid);
02757         /* Currently, the filter_fid::ff_parent::f_ver is not the real parent
02758          * MDT-object's FID::f_ver, instead it is the OST-object index in its
02759          * parent MDT-object's layout EA. */
02760         pfid->ff_parent.f_stripe_idx = cpu_to_le32(llr->llr_lov_idx);
02761         buf = lfsck_buf_get(env, pfid, sizeof(struct filter_fid));
02762 
02763         handle = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
02764         if (IS_ERR(handle))
02765                 GOTO(unlock1, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
02766 
02767         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, child, buf, XATTR_NAME_FID, 0, handle);
02768         if (rc != 0)
02769                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02770 
02771         rc = dt_attr_get(env, parent, la);
02772         if (rc != 0)
02773                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02774 
02775         la->la_valid = LA_UID | LA_GID;
02776         rc = dt_declare_attr_set(env, child, la, handle);
02777         if (rc != 0)
02778                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02779 
02780         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, handle);
02781         if (rc != 0)
02782                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02783 
02784         dt_write_lock(env, parent, 0);
02785         if (unlikely(lfsck_is_dead_obj(parent)))
02786                 GOTO(unlock2, rc = 1);
02787 
02788         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, child, buf, XATTR_NAME_FID, 0, handle);
02789         if (rc != 0)
02790                 GOTO(unlock2, rc);
02791 
02792         /* Get the latest parent's owner. */
02793         rc = dt_attr_get(env, parent, la);
02794         if (rc != 0)
02795                 GOTO(unlock2, rc);
02796 
02797         la->la_valid = LA_UID | LA_GID;
02798         rc = dt_attr_set(env, child, la, handle);
02799 
02800         GOTO(unlock2, rc);
02801 
02802 unlock2:
02803         dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02804 
02805 stop:
02806         rc = lfsck_layout_trans_stop(env, dev, handle, rc);
02807 
02808 unlock1:
02809         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02810 
02811 log:
02812         if (rc != 0)
02813                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant repaired "
02814                        "unmatched MDT-OST pair for: parent "DFID
02815                        ", child "DFID", OST-index %u, stripe-index %u, "
02816                        "owner %u/%u: rc = %d\n",
02817                        lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
02818                        PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)),
02819                        PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(child)),
02820                        llr->llr_ost_idx, llr->llr_lov_idx,
02821                        la->la_uid, la->la_gid, rc);
02822 
02823         return rc;
02824 }
02825 
02826 /* If there are more than one MDT-objects claim as the OST-object's parent,
02827  * and the OST-object only recognizes one of them, then we need to generate
02828  * new OST-object(s) with new fid(s) for the non-recognized MDT-object(s). */
02829 static int lfsck_layout_repair_multiple_references(const struct lu_env *env,
02830                                                    struct lfsck_component *com,
02831                                                    struct dt_object *parent,
02832                                                    struct lfsck_layout_req *llr,
02833                                                    struct lu_attr *la,
02834                                                    struct lu_buf *buf)
02835 {
02836         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
02837         struct dt_allocation_hint       *hint   = &info->lti_hint;
02838         struct dt_object_format         *dof    = &info->lti_dof;
02839         struct ost_id                   *oi     = &info->lti_oi;
02840         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
02841         struct dt_device                *dev;
02842         struct lu_device                *d      =
02843                                 &lfsck_obj2dev(llr->llr_child)->dd_lu_dev;
02844         struct lu_object                *o;
02845         struct lu_object                *n;
02846         struct dt_object                *child  = NULL;
02847         struct thandle                  *handle = NULL;
02848         struct lov_mds_md_v1            *lmm;
02849         struct lov_ost_data_v1          *objs;
02850         const struct lu_fid             *pfid   = lfsck_dto2fid(parent);
02851         struct lu_fid                    tfid;
02852         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
02853         struct lu_buf                    ea_buf;
02854         __u32                            magic;
02855         __u32                            index;
02856         int                              rc;
02857         ENTRY;
02858 
02859         /* We use two separated transactions to repair the inconsistency.
02860          *
02861          * 1) create the child (OST-object).
02862          * 2) update the parent LOV EA according to the child's FID.
02863          *
02864          * If 1) succeed, but 2) failed or aborted, then such OST-object will be
02865          * handled as orphan when the layout LFSCK run next time.
02866          *
02867          * If 1) failed, but 2) succeed, then such OST-object will be re-created
02868          * as dangling referened case when the layout LFSCK run next time. */
02869 
02870         /* The 1st transaction. */
02871         o = lu_object_anon(env, d, NULL);
02872         if (IS_ERR(o))
02873                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(o));
02874 
02875         n = lu_object_locate(o->lo_header, d->ld_type);
02876         if (unlikely(n == NULL)) {
02877                 lu_object_put_nocache(env, o);
02878 
02879                 GOTO(log, rc = -EINVAL);
02880         }
02881 
02882         child = container_of(n, struct dt_object, do_lu);
02883         memset(hint, 0, sizeof(*hint));
02884         rc = dt_attr_get(env, parent, la);
02885         if (rc != 0)
02886                 GOTO(log, rc);
02887 
02888         la->la_valid = LA_UID | LA_GID;
02889         memset(dof, 0, sizeof(*dof));
02890 
02891         dev = lfsck_obj2dev(child);
02892         handle = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
02893         if (IS_ERR(handle))
02894                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
02895 
02896         rc = dt_declare_create(env, child, la, hint, dof, handle);
02897         if (rc != 0)
02898                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02899 
02900         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, handle);
02901         if (rc != 0)
02902                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02903 
02904         rc = dt_create(env, child, la, hint, dof, handle);
02905         dt_trans_stop(env, dev, handle);
02906         handle = NULL;
02907         if (rc != 0)
02908                 GOTO(log, rc);
02909 
02910         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, lfsck, parent, &lh,
02911                               MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT | MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
02912                               LCK_EX);
02913         if (rc != 0)
02914                 GOTO(log, rc);
02915 
02916         /* The 2nd transaction. */
02917 
02918         /* XXX: Generally, we should use bottom device (OSD) to update parent
02919          *      LOV EA. But because the LOD-object still references the wrong
02920          *      OSP-object that should be detached after the parent's LOV EA
02921          *      refreshed. Unfortunately, there is no suitable API for that.
02922          *      So we have to make the LOD to re-load the OSP-object(s) via
02923          *      replacing the LOV EA against the LOD-object.
02924          *
02925          *      Once the DNE2 patches have been landed, we can replace the
02926          *      LOD device with the OSD device. LU-6230. */
02927 
02928         dev = lfsck->li_next;
02929         parent = lfsck_object_locate(dev, parent);
02930         if (IS_ERR(parent))
02931                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(parent));
02932 
02933         handle = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
02934         if (IS_ERR(handle))
02935                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
02936 
02937         rc = dt_declare_xattr_set(env, parent, buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
02938                                   LU_XATTR_REPLACE, handle);
02939         if (rc != 0)
02940                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02941 
02942         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, handle);
02943         if (rc != 0)
02944                 GOTO(stop, rc);
02945 
02946         dt_write_lock(env, parent, 0);
02947         if (unlikely(lfsck_is_dead_obj(parent)))
02948                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
02949 
02950         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, parent, buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV);
02951         if (unlikely(rc == 0 || rc == -ENODATA || rc == -ERANGE))
02952                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
02953 
02954         lmm = buf->lb_buf;
02955         /* Currently, we only support LOV_MAGIC_V1/LOV_MAGIC_V3 which has
02956          * been verified in lfsck_layout_verify_header() already. If some
02957          * new magic introduced in the future, then layout LFSCK needs to
02958          * be updated also. */
02959         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
02960         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1) {
02961                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[llr->llr_lov_idx];
02962         } else {
02963                 LASSERT(magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3);
02964                 objs =
02965                 &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->lmm_objects[llr->llr_lov_idx];
02966         }
02967 
02968         ostid_le_to_cpu(&objs->l_ost_oi, oi);
02969         index = le32_to_cpu(objs->l_ost_idx);
02970         rc = ostid_to_fid(&tfid, oi, index);
02971         /* Someone changed layout during the LFSCK, no need to repair then. */
02972         if (rc == 0 && !lu_fid_eq(&tfid, lu_object_fid(&llr->llr_child->do_lu)))
02973                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
02974 
02975         lmm->lmm_layout_gen = cpu_to_le16(le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_layout_gen) + 1);
02976         fid_to_ostid(lu_object_fid(&child->do_lu), oi);
02977         ostid_cpu_to_le(oi, &objs->l_ost_oi);
02978         objs->l_ost_gen = cpu_to_le32(0);
02979         objs->l_ost_idx = cpu_to_le32(llr->llr_ost_idx);
02980         lfsck_buf_init(&ea_buf, lmm,
02981                        lov_mds_md_size(le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count),
02982                                        magic));
02983         rc = dt_xattr_set(env, parent, &ea_buf, XATTR_NAME_LOV,
02984                           LU_XATTR_REPLACE, handle);
02985 
02986         GOTO(unlock, rc = (rc == 0 ? 1 : rc));
02987 
02988 unlock:
02989         dt_write_unlock(env, parent);
02990 
02991 stop:
02992         if (handle != NULL)
02993                 dt_trans_stop(env, dev, handle);
02994 
02995 log:
02996         lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
02997         if (child != NULL)
02998                 lfsck_object_put(env, child);
02999 
03000         if (rc != 0)
03001                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant repaired "
03002                        "multiple references for: parent "DFID", OST-index %u, "
03003                        "stripe-index %u, owner %u/%u: rc = %d\n",
03004                        lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), PFID(pfid), llr->llr_ost_idx,
03005                        llr->llr_lov_idx, la->la_uid, la->la_gid, rc);
03006 
03007         return rc;
03008 }
03009 
03010 /* If the MDT-object and the OST-object have different owner information,
03011  * then trust the MDT-object, because the normal chown/chgrp handle order
03012  * is from MDT to OST, and it is possible that some chown/chgrp operation
03013  * is partly done. */
03014 static int lfsck_layout_repair_owner(const struct lu_env *env,
03015                                      struct lfsck_component *com,
03016                                      struct dt_object *parent,
03017                                      struct lfsck_layout_req *llr,
03018                                      struct lu_attr *pla,
03019                                      const struct lu_attr *cla)
03020 {
03021         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
03022         struct lu_attr                  *tla    = &info->lti_la2;
03023         struct dt_object                *child  = llr->llr_child;
03024         struct dt_device                *dev    = lfsck_obj2dev(child);
03025         struct thandle                  *handle;
03026         int                              rc;
03027         ENTRY;
03028 
03029         tla->la_uid = pla->la_uid;
03030         tla->la_gid = pla->la_gid;
03031         tla->la_valid = LA_UID | LA_GID;
03032         handle = dt_trans_create(env, dev);
03033         if (IS_ERR(handle))
03034                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(handle));
03035 
03036         rc = dt_declare_attr_set(env, child, tla, handle);
03037         if (rc != 0)
03038                 GOTO(stop, rc);
03039 
03040         rc = dt_trans_start_local(env, dev, handle);
03041         if (rc != 0)
03042                 GOTO(stop, rc);
03043 
03044         /* Use the dt_object lock to serialize with destroy and attr_set. */
03045         dt_read_lock(env, parent, 0);
03046         if (unlikely(lfsck_is_dead_obj(parent)))
03047                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 1);
03048 
03049         /* Get the latest parent's owner. */
03050         rc = dt_attr_get(env, parent, pla);
03051         if (rc != 0)
03052                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
03053 
03054         /* Some others chown/chgrp during the LFSCK, needs to do nothing. */
03055         if (unlikely(tla->la_uid != pla->la_uid ||
03056                      tla->la_gid != pla->la_gid))
03057                 rc = 1;
03058         else
03059                 rc = dt_attr_set(env, child, tla, handle);
03060 
03061         GOTO(unlock, rc);
03062 
03063 unlock:
03064         dt_read_unlock(env, parent);
03065 
03066 stop:
03067         rc = lfsck_layout_trans_stop(env, dev, handle, rc);
03068 
03069 log:
03070         if (rc != 0)
03071                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant repaired "
03072                        "inconsistent file owner for: parent "DFID", child "DFID
03073                        ", OST-index %u, stripe-index %u, old owner %u/%u, "
03074                        "new owner %u/%u: rc = %d\n",
03075                        lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
03076                        PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(parent)), PFID(lfsck_dto2fid(child)),
03077                        llr->llr_ost_idx, llr->llr_lov_idx,
03078                        cla->la_uid, cla->la_gid, tla->la_uid, tla->la_gid, rc);
03079 
03080         return rc;
03081 }
03082 
03083 /* Check whether the OST-object correctly back points to the
03084  * MDT-object (@parent) via the XATTR_NAME_FID xattr (@pfid). */
03085 static int lfsck_layout_check_parent(const struct lu_env *env,
03086                                      struct lfsck_component *com,
03087                                      struct lfsck_assistant_object *lso,
03088                                      const struct lu_fid *pfid,
03089                                      const struct lu_fid *cfid,
03090                                      const struct lu_attr *cla,
03091                                      struct lfsck_layout_req *llr,
03092                                      struct lu_buf *lov_ea, __u32 idx)
03093 {
03094         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
03095         struct lu_buf                   *buf    = &info->lti_big_buf;
03096         struct dt_object                *tobj;
03097         struct lov_mds_md_v1            *lmm;
03098         struct lov_ost_data_v1          *objs;
03099         struct lustre_handle             lh     = { 0 };
03100         int                              rc;
03101         int                              i;
03102         __u32                            magic;
03103         __u16                            count;
03104         ENTRY;
03105 
03106         if (unlikely(!fid_is_sane(pfid)))
03107                 RETURN(LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR);
03108 
03109         if (lu_fid_eq(pfid, &lso->lso_fid)) {
03110                 if (likely(llr->llr_lov_idx == idx))
03111                         RETURN(0);
03112 
03113                 RETURN(LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR);
03114         }
03115 
03116         tobj = lfsck_object_find_bottom(env, com->lc_lfsck, pfid);
03117         if (IS_ERR(tobj))
03118                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(tobj));
03119 
03120         if (dt_object_exists(tobj) == 0 || lfsck_is_dead_obj(tobj) ||
03121             !S_ISREG(lfsck_object_type(tobj)))
03122                 GOTO(out, rc = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR);
03123 
03124         /* Load the tobj's layout EA, in spite of it is a local MDT-object or
03125          * remote one on another MDT. Then check whether the given OST-object
03126          * is in such layout. If yes, it is multiple referenced, otherwise it
03127          * is unmatched referenced case. */
03128         rc = lfsck_layout_get_lovea(env, tobj, buf);
03129         if (rc == 0 || rc == -ENOENT)
03130                 GOTO(out, rc = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR);
03131 
03132         if (rc < 0)
03133                 GOTO(out, rc);
03134 
03135         lmm = buf->lb_buf;
03136         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
03137         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1) {
03138                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[0];
03139         } else {
03140                 LASSERT(magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3);
03141                 objs = &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->lmm_objects[0];
03142         }
03143 
03144         count = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count);
03145         for (i = 0; i < count; i++, objs++) {
03146                 struct lu_fid           *tfid   = &info->lti_fid2;
03147                 struct ost_id           *oi     = &info->lti_oi;
03148                 __u32                    idx2;
03149 
03150                 if (lovea_slot_is_dummy(objs))
03151                         continue;
03152 
03153                 ostid_le_to_cpu(&objs->l_ost_oi, oi);
03154                 idx2 = le32_to_cpu(objs->l_ost_idx);
03155                 rc = ostid_to_fid(tfid, oi, idx2);
03156                 if (rc != 0) {
03157                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: the parent "DFID" contains "
03158                                "invalid layout EA at the slot %d, index %u\n",
03159                                lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
03160                                PFID(pfid), i, idx2);
03161 
03162                         GOTO(out, rc = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR);
03163                 }
03164 
03165                 if (lu_fid_eq(cfid, tfid)) {
03166                         rc = lfsck_ibits_lock(env, com->lc_lfsck, tobj, &lh,
03167                                               MDS_INODELOCK_UPDATE |
03168                                               MDS_INODELOCK_LAYOUT |
03169                                               MDS_INODELOCK_XATTR,
03170                                               LCK_EX);
03171                         if (rc != 0)
03172                                 GOTO(out, rc);
03173 
03174                         dt_read_lock(env, tobj, 0);
03175 
03176                         /* For local MDT-object, re-check existence
03177                          * after taken the lock. */
03178                         if (!dt_object_remote(tobj)) {
03179                                 if (dt_object_exists(tobj) == 0 ||
03180                                     lfsck_is_dead_obj(tobj)) {
03181                                         rc = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR;
03182                                 } else {
03183                                         *lov_ea = *buf;
03184                                         rc = LLIT_MULTIPLE_REFERENCED;
03185                                 }
03186 
03187                                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
03188                         }
03189 
03190                         /* For migration case, the new MDT-object and old
03191                          * MDT-object may reference the same OST-object at
03192                          * some migration internal time.
03193                          *
03194                          * For remote MDT-object, the local MDT may not know
03195                          * whether it has been removed or not.  Try checking
03196                          * for a non-existent xattr to check if this object
03197                          * has been been removed or not. */
03198                         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, tobj, &LU_BUF_NULL,
03199                                           XATTR_NAME_DUMMY);
03200                         if (unlikely(rc == -ENOENT || rc >= 0)) {
03201                                 rc = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR;
03202                         } else if (rc == -ENODATA) {
03203                                 *lov_ea = *buf;
03204                                 rc = LLIT_MULTIPLE_REFERENCED;
03205                         }
03206 
03207                         GOTO(unlock, rc);
03208                 }
03209         }
03210 
03211         GOTO(out, rc = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR);
03212 
03213 unlock:
03214         if (lustre_handle_is_used(&lh)) {
03215                 dt_read_unlock(env, tobj);
03216                 lfsck_ibits_unlock(&lh, LCK_EX);
03217         }
03218 
03219 out:
03220         lfsck_object_put(env, tobj);
03221 
03222         return rc;
03223 }
03224 
03225 static int lfsck_layout_assistant_handler_p1(const struct lu_env *env,
03226                                              struct lfsck_component *com,
03227                                              struct lfsck_assistant_req *lar)
03228 {
03229         struct lfsck_layout_req              *llr    =
03230                         container_of0(lar, struct lfsck_layout_req, llr_lar);
03231         struct lfsck_assistant_object        *lso    = lar->lar_parent;
03232         struct lfsck_layout                  *lo     = com->lc_file_ram;
03233         struct lfsck_thread_info             *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
03234         struct filter_fid_old                *pea    = &info->lti_old_pfid;
03235         struct lu_fid                        *pfid   = &info->lti_fid;
03236         struct lu_buf                         buf    = { NULL };
03237         struct dt_object                     *parent = NULL;
03238         struct dt_object                     *child  = llr->llr_child;
03239         struct lu_attr                       *pla    = &lso->lso_attr;
03240         struct lu_attr                       *cla    = &info->lti_la;
03241         struct lfsck_instance                *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
03242         struct lfsck_bookmark                *bk     = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
03243         enum lfsck_layout_inconsistency_type  type   = LLIT_NONE;
03244         __u32                                 idx    = 0;
03245         int                                   rc;
03246         ENTRY;
03247 
03248         if (lso->lso_dead)
03249                 RETURN(0);
03250 
03251         CFS_FAIL_TIMEOUT(OBD_FAIL_LFSCK_ASSISTANT_DIRECT, cfs_fail_val);
03252 
03253         rc = dt_attr_get(env, child, cla);
03254         if (rc == -ENOENT) {
03255                 parent = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck, lso);
03256                 if (IS_ERR(parent)) {
03257                         rc = PTR_ERR(parent);
03258 
03259                         RETURN(rc == -ENOENT ? 0 : rc);
03260                 }
03261 
03262                 type = LLIT_DANGLING;
03263                 goto repair;
03264         }
03265 
03266         if (rc != 0)
03267                 GOTO(out, rc);
03268 
03269         lfsck_buf_init(&buf, pea, sizeof(struct filter_fid_old));
03270         rc = dt_xattr_get(env, child, &buf, XATTR_NAME_FID);
03271         if (unlikely(rc > 0 && rc != sizeof(struct filter_fid_old) &&
03272                      rc != sizeof(struct filter_fid))) {
03273                 type = LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR;
03274                 goto repair;
03275         }
03276 
03277         if (rc < 0 && rc != -ENODATA)
03278                 GOTO(out, rc);
03279 
03280         if (rc == 0 || rc == -ENODATA)
03281                 GOTO(check_owner, rc = 0);
03282 
03283         fid_le_to_cpu(pfid, &pea->ff_parent);
03284         /* Currently, the filter_fid::ff_parent::f_ver is not the
03285          * real parent MDT-object's FID::f_ver, instead it is the
03286          * OST-object index in its parent MDT-object's layout EA. */
03287         idx = pfid->f_stripe_idx;
03288         pfid->f_ver = 0;
03289         rc = lfsck_layout_check_parent(env, com, lso, pfid,
03290                                        lu_object_fid(&child->do_lu),
03291                                        cla, llr, &buf, idx);
03292         if (rc > 0) {
03293                 type = rc;
03294                 goto repair;
03295         }
03296 
03297         if (rc < 0)
03298                 GOTO(out, rc);
03299 
03300 check_owner:
03301         /* Someone may has changed the owner after the parent attr pre-loaded.
03302          * It can be handled later inside the lfsck_layout_repair_owner(). */
03303         if (unlikely(cla->la_uid != pla->la_uid ||
03304                      cla->la_gid != pla->la_gid)) {
03305                 type = LLIT_INCONSISTENT_OWNER;
03306                 goto repair;
03307         }
03308 
03309 repair:
03310         if (type == LLIT_NONE)
03311                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
03312 
03313         if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN)
03314                 GOTO(out, rc = 1);
03315 
03316         if (parent == NULL) {
03317                 parent = lfsck_assistant_object_load(env, lfsck, lso);
03318                 if (IS_ERR(parent)) {
03319                         rc = PTR_ERR(parent);
03320 
03321                         if (rc == -ENOENT)
03322                                 RETURN(0);
03323 
03324                         GOTO(out, rc);
03325                 }
03326         }
03327 
03328         switch (type) {
03329         case LLIT_DANGLING:
03330                 rc = lfsck_layout_repair_dangling(env, com, parent, llr, pla);
03331                 break;
03332         case LLIT_UNMATCHED_PAIR:
03333                 rc = lfsck_layout_repair_unmatched_pair(env, com, parent,
03334                                                         llr, pla);
03335                 break;
03336         case LLIT_MULTIPLE_REFERENCED:
03337                 rc = lfsck_layout_repair_multiple_references(env, com, parent,
03338                                                              llr, pla, &buf);
03339                 break;
03340         case LLIT_INCONSISTENT_OWNER:
03341                 rc = lfsck_layout_repair_owner(env, com, parent, llr, pla, cla);
03342                 break;
03343         default:
03344                 rc = 0;
03345                 break;
03346         }
03347 
03348         GOTO(out, rc);
03349 
03350 out:
03351         down_write(&com->lc_sem);
03352         if (rc < 0) {
03353                 struct lfsck_assistant_data *lad = com->lc_data;
03354 
03355                 if (unlikely(lad->lad_exit)) {
03356                         rc = 0;
03357                 } else if (rc == -ENOTCONN || rc == -ESHUTDOWN ||
03358                            rc == -ETIMEDOUT || rc == -EHOSTDOWN ||
03359                            rc == -EHOSTUNREACH) {
03360                         /* If cannot touch the target server,
03361                          * mark the LFSCK as INCOMPLETE. */
03362                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK assistant fail to "
03363                                "talk with OST %x: rc = %d\n",
03364                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), llr->llr_ost_idx, rc);
03365                         lfsck_lad_set_bitmap(env, com, llr->llr_ost_idx);
03366                         lo->ll_objs_skipped++;
03367                         rc = 0;
03368                 } else {
03369                         lfsck_layout_record_failure(env, lfsck, lo);
03370                 }
03371         } else if (rc > 0) {
03372                 LASSERTF(type > LLIT_NONE && type <= LLIT_MAX,
03373                          "unknown type = %d\n", type);
03374 
03375                 lo->ll_objs_repaired[type - 1]++;
03376                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_DRYRUN &&
03377                     unlikely(lo->ll_pos_first_inconsistent == 0))
03378                         lo->ll_pos_first_inconsistent =
03379                         lfsck->li_obj_oit->do_index_ops->dio_it.store(env,
03380                                                         lfsck->li_di_oit);
03381         }
03382         up_write(&com->lc_sem);
03383 
03384         if (parent != NULL && !IS_ERR(parent))
03385                 lfsck_object_put(env, parent);
03386 
03387         return rc;
03388 }
03389 
03390 static int lfsck_layout_assistant_handler_p2(const struct lu_env *env,
03391                                              struct lfsck_component *com)
03392 {
03393         struct lfsck_assistant_data     *lad    = com->lc_data;
03394         struct lfsck_instance           *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
03395         struct lfsck_bookmark           *bk     = &lfsck->li_bookmark_ram;
03396         struct lfsck_tgt_descs          *ltds   = &lfsck->li_ost_descs;
03397         struct lfsck_tgt_desc           *ltd;
03398         int                              rc     = 0;
03399         ENTRY;
03400 
03401         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK phase2 scan start\n",
03402                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck));
03403 
03404         spin_lock(&ltds->ltd_lock);
03405         while (!list_empty(&lad->lad_ost_phase2_list)) {
03406                 ltd = list_entry(lad->lad_ost_phase2_list.next,
03407                                  struct lfsck_tgt_desc,
03408                                  ltd_layout_phase_list);
03409                 list_del_init(&ltd->ltd_layout_phase_list);
03410                 if (bk->lb_param & LPF_ALL_TGT) {
03411                         spin_unlock(&ltds->ltd_lock);
03412                         rc = lfsck_layout_scan_orphan(env, com, ltd);
03413                         if (rc != 0 && bk->lb_param & LPF_FAILOUT)
03414                                 RETURN(rc);
03415 
03416                         if (unlikely(lad->lad_exit ||
03417                                      !thread_is_running(&lfsck->li_thread)))
03418                                 RETURN(0);
03419                         spin_lock(&ltds->ltd_lock);
03420                 }
03421         }
03422 
03423         if (list_empty(&lad->lad_ost_phase1_list))
03424                 rc = 1;
03425         else
03426                 rc = 0;
03427         spin_unlock(&ltds->ltd_lock);
03428 
03429         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK phase2 scan stop: rc = %d\n",
03430                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck), rc);
03431 
03432         RETURN(rc);
03433 }
03434 
03435 static int
03436 lfsck_layout_slave_async_interpret(const struct lu_env *env,
03437                                    struct ptlrpc_request *req,
03438                                    void *args, int rc)
03439 {
03440         struct lfsck_layout_slave_async_args *llsaa = args;
03441         struct obd_export                    *exp   = llsaa->llsaa_exp;
03442         struct lfsck_component               *com   = llsaa->llsaa_com;
03443         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target     *llst  = llsaa->llsaa_llst;
03444         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data       *llsd  = com->lc_data;
03445         struct lfsck_reply                   *lr    = NULL;
03446         bool                                  done  = false;
03447 
03448         if (rc != 0) {
03449                 /* It is probably caused by network trouble, or target crash,
03450                  * it will try several times (depends on the obd_timeout, and
03451                  * will not less than 3 times). But to make the LFSCK can go
03452                  * ahead, we should not try for ever. After some try but still
03453                  * hit failure, it will assume that the target exit the LFSCK
03454                  * prcoessing and stop try. */
03455                 if (rc == -ENOTCONN || rc == -ESHUTDOWN) {
03456                         int max_try = max_t(int, obd_timeout / 30, 3);
03457 
03458                         if (++(llst->llst_failures) > max_try)
03459                                 done = true;
03460                 } else {
03461                         done = true;
03462                 }
03463         } else {
03464                 llst->llst_failures = 0;
03465                 lr = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REPLY);
03466                 if (lr->lr_status != LS_SCANNING_PHASE1 &&
03467                     lr->lr_status != LS_SCANNING_PHASE2)
03468                         done = true;
03469         }
03470 
03471         if (done) {
03472                 CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK slave gets the MDT %x "
03473                        "status %d, failures_try %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
03474                        llst->llst_index, lr != NULL ? lr->lr_status : rc,
03475                        llst->llst_failures);
03476 
03477                 lfsck_layout_llst_del(llsd, llst);
03478         }
03479 
03480         lfsck_layout_llst_put(llst);
03481         lfsck_component_put(env, com);
03482         class_export_put(exp);
03483 
03484         return 0;
03485 }
03486 
03487 static int lfsck_layout_async_query(const struct lu_env *env,
03488                                     struct lfsck_component *com,
03489                                     struct obd_export *exp,
03490                                     struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst,
03491                                     struct lfsck_request *lr,
03492                                     struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
03493 {
03494         struct lfsck_layout_slave_async_args *llsaa;
03495         struct ptlrpc_request                *req;
03496         struct lfsck_request                 *tmp;
03497         int                                   rc;
03498         ENTRY;
03499 
03500         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_LFSCK_QUERY);
03501         if (req == NULL)
03502                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
03503 
03504         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, LFSCK_QUERY);
03505         if (rc != 0) {
03506                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
03507                 RETURN(rc);
03508         }
03509 
03510         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
03511         *tmp = *lr;
03512         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
03513 
03514         llsaa = ptlrpc_req_async_args(req);
03515         llsaa->llsaa_exp = exp;
03516         llsaa->llsaa_com = lfsck_component_get(com);
03517         llsaa->llsaa_llst = llst;
03518         req->rq_interpret_reply = lfsck_layout_slave_async_interpret;
03519         req->rq_allow_intr = 1;
03520         ptlrpc_set_add_req(set, req);
03521 
03522         RETURN(0);
03523 }
03524 
03525 static int lfsck_layout_async_notify(const struct lu_env *env,
03526                                      struct obd_export *exp,
03527                                      struct lfsck_request *lr,
03528                                      struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
03529 {
03530         struct ptlrpc_request   *req;
03531         struct lfsck_request    *tmp;
03532         int                      rc;
03533         ENTRY;
03534 
03535         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_LFSCK_NOTIFY);
03536         if (req == NULL)
03537                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
03538 
03539         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, LFSCK_NOTIFY);
03540         if (rc != 0) {
03541                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
03542                 RETURN(rc);
03543         }
03544 
03545         tmp = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
03546         *tmp = *lr;
03547         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
03548         req->rq_allow_intr = 1;
03549         ptlrpc_set_add_req(set, req);
03550 
03551         RETURN(0);
03552 }
03553 
03554 static int
03555 lfsck_layout_slave_query_master(const struct lu_env *env,
03556                                 struct lfsck_component *com)
03557 {
03558         struct lfsck_request             *lr    = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lr;
03559         struct lfsck_instance            *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
03560         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data   *llsd  = com->lc_data;
03561         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst;
03562         struct obd_export                *exp;
03563         struct ptlrpc_request_set        *set;
03564         int                               rc    = 0;
03565         int                               rc1   = 0;
03566         ENTRY;
03567 
03568         set = ptlrpc_prep_set();
03569         if (set == NULL)
03570                 GOTO(log, rc = -ENOMEM);
03571 
03572         memset(lr, 0, sizeof(*lr));
03573         lr->lr_event = LE_QUERY;
03574         lr->lr_active = LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT;
03575 
03576         llsd->llsd_touch_gen++;
03577         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03578         while (!list_empty(&llsd->llsd_master_list)) {
03579                 llst = list_entry(llsd->llsd_master_list.next,
03580                                   struct lfsck_layout_slave_target,
03581                                   llst_list);
03582                 if (llst->llst_gen == llsd->llsd_touch_gen)
03583                         break;
03584 
03585                 llst->llst_gen = llsd->llsd_touch_gen;
03586                 list_move_tail(&llst->llst_list,
03587                                &llsd->llsd_master_list);
03588                 atomic_inc(&llst->llst_ref);
03589                 spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03590 
03591                 exp = lustre_find_lwp_by_index(lfsck->li_obd->obd_name,
03592                                                llst->llst_index);
03593                 if (exp == NULL) {
03594                         lfsck_layout_llst_del(llsd, llst);
03595                         lfsck_layout_llst_put(llst);
03596                         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03597                         continue;
03598                 }
03599 
03600                 rc = lfsck_layout_async_query(env, com, exp, llst, lr, set);
03601                 if (rc != 0) {
03602                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK slave fail to "
03603                                "query %s for layout: rc = %d\n",
03604                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
03605                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
03606 
03607                         rc1 = rc;
03608                         lfsck_layout_llst_put(llst);
03609                         class_export_put(exp);
03610                 }
03611                 spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03612         }
03613         spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03614 
03615         rc = ptlrpc_set_wait(set);
03616         ptlrpc_set_destroy(set);
03617 
03618         GOTO(log, rc = (rc1 != 0 ? rc1 : rc));
03619 
03620 log:
03621         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK slave queries master: rc = %d\n",
03622                lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck), rc);
03623 
03624         return rc;
03625 }
03626 
03627 static void
03628 lfsck_layout_slave_notify_master(const struct lu_env *env,
03629                                  struct lfsck_component *com,
03630                                  enum lfsck_events event, int result)
03631 {
03632         struct lfsck_layout              *lo    = com->lc_file_ram;
03633         struct lfsck_instance            *lfsck = com->lc_lfsck;
03634         struct lfsck_layout_slave_data   *llsd  = com->lc_data;
03635         struct lfsck_request             *lr    = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_lr;
03636         struct lfsck_layout_slave_target *llst;
03637         struct obd_export                *exp;
03638         struct ptlrpc_request_set        *set;
03639         int                               rc;
03640         ENTRY;
03641 
03642         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK slave notifies master\n",
03643                lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck));
03644 
03645         set = ptlrpc_prep_set();
03646         if (set == NULL)
03647                 RETURN_EXIT;
03648 
03649         memset(lr, 0, sizeof(*lr));
03650         lr->lr_event = event;
03651         lr->lr_flags = LEF_FROM_OST;
03652         lr->lr_status = result;
03653         lr->lr_index = lfsck_dev_idx(lfsck);
03654         lr->lr_active = LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT;
03655         lr->lr_flags2 = lo->ll_flags;
03656         llsd->llsd_touch_gen++;
03657         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03658         while (!list_empty(&llsd->llsd_master_list)) {
03659                 llst = list_entry(llsd->llsd_master_list.next,
03660                                   struct lfsck_layout_slave_target,
03661                                   llst_list);
03662                 if (llst->llst_gen == llsd->llsd_touch_gen)
03663                         break;
03664 
03665                 llst->llst_gen = llsd->llsd_touch_gen;
03666                 list_move_tail(&llst->llst_list,
03667                                &llsd->llsd_master_list);
03668                 atomic_inc(&llst->llst_ref);
03669                 spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03670 
03671                 exp = lustre_find_lwp_by_index(lfsck->li_obd->obd_name,
03672                                                llst->llst_index);
03673                 if (exp == NULL) {
03674                         lfsck_layout_llst_del(llsd, llst);
03675                         lfsck_layout_llst_put(llst);
03676                         spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03677                         continue;
03678                 }
03679 
03680                 rc = lfsck_layout_async_notify(env, exp, lr, set);
03681                 if (rc != 0)
03682                         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK slave fail to "
03683                                "notify %s for layout: rc = %d\n",
03684                                lfsck_lfsck2name(lfsck),
03685                                exp->exp_obd->obd_name, rc);
03686 
03687                 lfsck_layout_llst_put(llst);
03688                 class_export_put(exp);
03689                 spin_lock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03690         }
03691         spin_unlock(&llsd->llsd_lock);
03692 
03693         ptlrpc_set_wait(set);
03694         ptlrpc_set_destroy(set);
03695 
03696         RETURN_EXIT;
03697 }
03698 
03699 /*
03700  * \ret -ENODATA: unrecognized stripe
03701  * \ret = 0     : recognized stripe
03702  * \ret < 0     : other failures
03703  */
03704 static int lfsck_layout_master_check_pairs(const struct lu_env *env,
03705                                            struct lfsck_component *com,
03706                                            struct lu_fid *cfid,
03707                                            struct lu_fid *pfid)
03708 {
03709         struct lfsck_thread_info        *info   = lfsck_env_info(env);
03710         struct lu_buf                   *buf    = &info->lti_big_buf;
03711         struct ost_id                   *oi     = &info->lti_oi;
03712         struct dt_object                *obj;
03713         struct lov_mds_md_v1            *lmm;
03714         struct lov_ost_data_v1          *objs;
03715         __u32                            idx    = pfid->f_stripe_idx;
03716         __u32                            magic;
03717         int                              rc     = 0;
03718         int                              i;
03719         __u16                            count;
03720         ENTRY;
03721 
03722         pfid->f_ver = 0;
03723         obj = lfsck_object_find_bottom(env, com->lc_lfsck, pfid);
03724         if (IS_ERR(obj))
03725                 RETURN(PTR_ERR(obj));
03726 
03727         dt_read_lock(env, obj, 0);
03728         if (unlikely(dt_object_exists(obj) == 0 ||
03729                      lfsck_is_dead_obj(obj)))
03730                 GOTO(unlock, rc = -ENOENT);
03731 
03732         if (!S_ISREG(lfsck_object_type(obj)))
03733                 GOTO(unlock, rc = -ENODATA);
03734 
03735         rc = lfsck_layout_get_lovea(env, obj, buf);
03736         if (rc < 0)
03737                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
03738 
03739         if (rc == 0)
03740                 GOTO(unlock, rc = -ENODATA);
03741 
03742         lmm = buf->lb_buf;
03743         rc = lfsck_layout_verify_header(lmm);
03744         if (rc != 0)
03745                 GOTO(unlock, rc);
03746 
03747         /* Currently, we only support LOV_MAGIC_V1/LOV_MAGIC_V3 which has
03748          * been verified in lfsck_layout_verify_header() already. If some
03749          * new magic introduced in the future, then layout LFSCK needs to
03750          * be updated also. */
03751         magic = le32_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_magic);
03752         if (magic == LOV_MAGIC_V1) {
03753                 objs = &lmm->lmm_objects[0];
03754         } else {
03755                 LASSERT(magic == LOV_MAGIC_V3);
03756                 objs = &((struct lov_mds_md_v3 *)lmm)->lmm_objects[0];
03757         }
03758 
03759         fid_to_ostid(cfid, oi);
03760         count = le16_to_cpu(lmm->lmm_stripe_count);
03761         for (i = 0; i < count; i++, objs++) {
03762                 struct ost_id oi2;
03763 
03764                 ostid_le_to_cpu(&objs->l_ost_oi, &oi2);
03765                 if (memcmp(oi, &oi2, sizeof(*oi)) == 0)
03766                         GOTO(unlock, rc = (i != idx ? -ENODATA : 0));
03767         }
03768 
03769         GOTO(unlock, rc = -ENODATA);
03770 
03771 unlock:
03772         dt_read_unlock(env, obj);
03773         lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
03774 
03775         return rc;
03776 }
03777 
03778 /*
03779  * The LFSCK-on-OST will ask the LFSCK-on-MDT to check whether the given
03780  * MDT-object/OST-object pairs match or not to aviod transfer MDT-object
03781  * layout EA from MDT to OST. On one hand, the OST no need to understand
03782  * the layout EA structure; on the other hand, it may cause trouble when
03783  * transfer large layout EA from MDT to OST via normal OUT RPC.
03784  *
03785  * \ret > 0: unrecognized stripe
03786  * \ret = 0: recognized stripe
03787  * \ret < 0: other failures
03788  */
03789 static int lfsck_layout_slave_check_pairs(const struct lu_env *env,
03790                                           struct lfsck_component *com,
03791                                           struct lu_fid *cfid,
03792                                           struct lu_fid *pfid)
03793 {
03794         struct lfsck_instance    *lfsck  = com->lc_lfsck;
03795         struct obd_device        *obd    = lfsck->li_obd;
03796         struct seq_server_site   *ss     = lfsck_dev_site(lfsck);
03797         struct obd_export        *exp    = NULL;
03798         struct ptlrpc_request    *req    = NULL;
03799         struct lfsck_request     *lr;
03800         struct lu_seq_range      *range  = &lfsck_env_info(env)->lti_range;
03801         int                       rc     = 0;
03802         ENTRY;
03803 
03804         if (unlikely(fid_is_idif(pfid)))
03805                 RETURN(1);
03806 
03807         fld_range_set_any(range);
03808         rc = fld_server_lookup(env, ss->ss_server_fld, fid_seq(pfid), range);
03809         if (rc != 0)
03810                 RETURN(rc == -ENOENT ? 1 : rc);
03811 
03812         if (unlikely(!fld_range_is_mdt(range)))
03813                 RETURN(1);
03814 
03815         exp = lustre_find_lwp_by_index(obd->obd_name, range->lsr_index);
03816         if (unlikely(exp == NULL))
03817                 RETURN(1);
03818 
03819         if (!(exp_connect_flags(exp) & OBD_CONNECT_LFSCK))
03820                 GOTO(out, rc = -EOPNOTSUPP);
03821 
03822         req = ptlrpc_request_alloc(class_exp2cliimp(exp), &RQF_LFSCK_NOTIFY);
03823         if (req == NULL)
03824                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
03825 
03826         rc = ptlrpc_request_pack(req, LUSTRE_OBD_VERSION, LFSCK_NOTIFY);
03827         if (rc != 0) {
03828                 ptlrpc_request_free(req);
03829 
03830                 GOTO(out, rc);
03831         }
03832 
03833         lr = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_LFSCK_REQUEST);
03834         memset(lr, 0, sizeof(*lr));
03835         lr->lr_event = LE_PAIRS_VERIFY;
03836         lr->lr_active = LFSCK_TYPE_LAYOUT;
03837         lr->lr_fid = *cfid; /* OST-object itself FID. */
03838         lr->lr_fid2 = *pfid; /* The claimed parent FID. */
03839 
03840         ptlrpc_request_set_replen(req);
03841         rc = ptlrpc_queue_wait(req);
03842         ptlrpc_req_finished(req);
03843 
03844         if (rc == -ENOENT || rc == -ENODATA)
03845                 rc = 1;
03846 
03847         GOTO(out, rc);
03848 
03849 out:
03850         if (exp != NULL)
03851                 class_export_put(exp);
03852 
03853         return rc;
03854 }
03855 
03856 static int lfsck_layout_slave_repair_pfid(const struct lu_env *env,
03857                                           struct lfsck_component *com,
03858                                           struct lfsck_request *lr)
03859 {
03860         struct dt_object        *obj;
03861         int                      rc     = 0;
03862         ENTRY;
03863 
03864         obj = lfsck_object_find_bottom(env, com->lc_lfsck, &lr->lr_fid);
03865         if (IS_ERR(obj))
03866                 GOTO(log, rc = PTR_ERR(obj));
03867 
03868         dt_write_lock(env, obj, 0);
03869         if (unlikely(dt_object_exists(obj) == 0 ||
03870                      lfsck_is_dead_obj(obj)))
03871                 GOTO(unlock, rc = 0);
03872 
03873         rc = __lfsck_layout_update_pfid(env, obj, &lr->lr_fid2,
03874                                         lr->lr_fid2.f_ver);
03875 
03876         GOTO(unlock, rc);
03877 
03878 unlock:
03879         dt_write_unlock(env, obj);
03880         lfsck_object_put(env, obj);
03881 
03882 log:
03883         CDEBUG(D_LFSCK, "%s: layout LFSCK slave repaired pfid for "DFID
03884                ", parent "DFID": rc = %d\n", lfsck_lfsck2name(com->lc_lfsck),
03885                PFID(&lr->lr_fid), PFID(&lr->lr_fid2), rc);
03886 
03887         return rc;
03888 }
03889 
03890 /* layout APIs */
03891 
03892 static void lfsck_layout_slave_quit(const struct lu_env *env,
